*************************************************
The scene is a group of children lazily lounging in a grove of meat apples. The children are holders of the some of The Spirits of The Ten Legendary Warriors. A young boy with a strange and very large orange hat is chasing butterflies. An older girl with blonde hair and a pink ensemble is lounging on a rock near the foot of a river, with her shoes off, feet in the river and slowly moving them back and forth. A slightly heavy boy dressed in a blue jumpsuit with yellow pockets is cooking what look likes apples over an ample fire. A boy with his hair in a ponytail and wearing dark blue is sitting with his arms behind his head in the shade of a tree. Two strange digimon, one in red tights and one with a large, pink, waist-sized girdle were off to the side, arguing. Lastly, a boy with a green cap and yellow shirt, with a red unbuttoned shirt over it, is lounging right in the middle of all the others, apparently sleeping. The smell of cooking steak and hot dogs appear to wake him up though.


Takuya yawns and stretches his arms an then sniffs the air. "J.P., are the meat apples done?" He asks drowsily. The boy cooking then turns to him and says, "Almost, but I don't see how you can be hungry. All you do is sleep." J.P. then sighs and gets back to cooking. Takuya only smiles and says, "I'm a growing boy! I need my meat, buddy!" He then pats his stomach, which then gives out a very loud gurgling noise. "You are growing Takuya!" A voice suddenly shrieks in his ear. Takuya turns around to see... "Kouji!" Takuya screams in a half surprised, half annoyed voice. The boy with the ponytail only smirks and continues. "In a horizontal direction." The boy known as Kouji states, demonstrating with his hands. Takuya then stares and blinks at him and then says, "Huh?" Ever-Clueless Takuya. Kouji sighs, but then giggles. "I mean you're getting..." Kouji says coming close to Takuya's face, making him blush slightly. "Fat!" he finishes while pulling up Takuya's shirt and grabbing hold of a small roll of flab. Takuya gasps and then blushes deeper and thinks,’ Have I really gained weight?' He had noticed his clothes being slightly tighter lately. Everyone around him then laughs. "W-well...I" Takuya stammers before he sees something that piques his interest and then smiles slyly. "So nice of you to notice Kouji..." Takuya says coolly, causing everyone to stop laughing and look at him in confusion. He then pulls Kouji down to the ground and gets on top of him, causing Kouji to go scarlet. "Maybe my new gut can compare to yours!" Takuya screams in victory as he pulls up Kouji's shirt, and lifting up a new layer of fat occupying HIS waistline. If possible, Kouji turns an even deeper shade of red, while everyone almost falls over laughing at Takuya's rebuttal. "You...two...need to go...to Fat Camp!" The girl in pink, ZoÃ«, says; causing her, J.P., and small child, Tommy, to laugh what little sanity they had left away. Takuya and Kouji then stand up, both still slightly blushing. Takuya then shouts in fury, "Hey! I'm not as fat as Kouji!" pointing to the accused in blue. "Are you calling ME fatter?! Take that back Takuya!" Kouji screams in embarrassed rage! "I'll prove it!" Takuya sat fiercely back. He then takes a hold of Kouji, who becomes confused in the sudden movement, and takes off his shirt, and his own. He then rams his belly into Kouji's, whose is actually almost identical. "Someone come over here to measure!" Takuya screams, to deaf ears though. Kouji is Tomato red and too mortified to move, and ZoÃ«, J.P., and Tommy are gasping for breath on the ground. ZoÃ«, albeit giggling and in tears, came back to her senses first. "They're...pretty much the same!" she managed to get out before Kouji's stomach growled, followed by Takuya's, sending her back into uncontrollable laughter.


By the time everyone finally came to, needing air at least, it was night and Kouji and Takuya had their shirts back on, and were ravenously eating meat apples. Takuya with a large bump on his head, most likely from Kouji. Tommy was the first to talk. "I can breathe again!" He celebrated reaching for a meat apple. J.P. replied with, "Dinner AND a show!" ZoÃ« was the only serious one. "Really you two; don’t worry about it! You only looked to have gained about 7 to 10 pounds, and it isn't even noticeable with your clothes on! You'll burn it off really quickly, after our...uh...vacation." she ended in uncertainty. J.P. then continued, "Yeah, those little bellies will vanish when we hear from Cherubimon or Ophanimon. We haven't heard from either in about two months, so it’s understandable that you would gain a little weight in our "time off". I'd say you've done well not to gain more weight, especially in this grove of delicious meat apples!" he then finished, taking a bite of his.
ZoÃ« then hesitated and nervously said, while blushing, "I actually...have been sneaking a meat apple or two every once in a while. I think I've gained weight too but-" She was interrupted when Takuya and Kouji who had been silent the whole time, mad at each other and mourning the loss of their flat stomachs when they looked up at the mention of when ZoÃ« said she had snuck meat apples and asked together, "You sneak meat apples too?" She only nodded and sighed exasperatedingly at the two and continued, "but I don't show weight in the same places as you two." She finished while blushing. J.P. was suddenly very red, but Takuya and Kouji only blinked. The Tommy tugged on her skirt tail and asked,” Where DO you show it ZoÃ«?" This made ZoÃ«’s cheeks turn slightly redder, but only a little. 'Tommy is young.' She thought, or she probably would have smacked him. **************************************************

If they woke up, they would see her for sure, and they might jump to the conclusion that she was with Cherubimon or had her own evil motives, and for that, they would be partially correct. She was turned over to one side in a hammock between two of the meat apple trees- one of the white meat apples had fallen from one of the trees into the hammock and had landed to her side.

A large, round table of stone simply rose from the earth a few feet away from him, and their were smaller rises littered around- chairs, Kouji would guess. Kouji himslef was sprawled out upund several cloth mats with a pile of straw beneath him, similar to traditional Japanese futons, basically in the center of the room. What little light that was filtering into the room came from a skylight of sorts behind him. Under that skylight there was also a pit and several branches and twigs, for a fire at night. Several torches also lined the walls but at the moment were out.

Straining his eyes even further, Kouji was also to make out several passageways throughout the large room he was currently in. Unlike normal cave passages, they were vertical and rectangular in shape, like most modern doors, but were slightly wider. However, so far away to where he could hardly see them, there was a quite large marble door.

His gaze locked on the door, Kouji's mind shifter from where he was and how he had gotten here to how he could get out. He would suppose those doors were the main entrance to the cave.

"Don't bother even thinking about that door. There's no use escaping. Not only is its weight colossal, but I've mackicked it to where it would take all of the Ten Legendary Warriors or pehaps the Dark Lord Cherubimon himself to break through it."

Kouji jumped at the voice that had suddenly penetrated his thought and the silence of the cave. Now he was able to see very faintly someone sitting on the other side of the large table-like rock formation he had noticed earlier.

Shock quickly turning to anger, Kouji stood and took a figting stance.

"And exactly who are you? Why did you bring me here?!" Kouji growled. "Are you working for Cherubimon?!"

The figure chuckled lightly and stood up to meander its way slowly into the dim light where Kouji was able to see it completely.

At first he had thought her to be human-but then glanced to her folded ebony wings, her strnage clothing, and the markings all over her body Other than that she could pass for a normal human teenage female, with long blonde hair and an entertained expression lining her features.

"I am Beliamon, and you, Warrior of Light," She said, lifting a dainty finger at Kouji, "are my prisoner until further notice from Dark lord Cherubimon."

Eyes narrowing in fury, Kouji reached for his digivice, but found it gone. Gasping, he searched for it, but to no avail.

Chuckling more loudly this, tome, Kouji turned back to Beliamon.

"Really Kouji, you underestimate my intelliegence! Do you honestly think I would let you hang on to that bauble of yours and actually become a threat to me?" Beliamon asked sarcastically.

"Where is it!? And where are we!? And how do you know my name!?" Kouji asked, his temper returning.

"Again, you underestimate my intelliegence. Your little trinket will be returned to you when the time is right, and no sooner. As for where we are," Beliamon paused shortly and her eyes became clouded. "We are in an isolated part of the Digital World that not even Trailmon have been able to reach for decades. This cave was once a temple for a village of arcane mage digimon, like myself, before...Dark Lord Cherubimon destroyed most of them...As for you name, you told me."

Kouji noted the hint of sadness in her voice, but was too angry at the strange digimon for kidnapping him to care.

"Well, you may have my digivice, but my friends will come for me!" He proclaimed, brushing off the fact on how she knew his name as her trying to mess with his head.

Beliamon glanced at his as if his IQ was three.

"Like I said, even Trailmon have not been able to reach this place for years, and while I suppose flying digimon could, I could easily dispense the Warrior of Wind." Beliamon stated confidently.

"IF you're so strong, give me my digivice and we'll fight." Kouji countered.

At Kouji's remark a hint of a smile came across her face.

"Nice try, Kouji, but no. I don't want to hurt you. If you havn't noticed, this cave is quite dark, and darkness is your weak point, yet my strong point. Anyway, you'd lose." She replied.

Kouji growled again at the insult to his power.

"What makes you so sure?" He asked, fury lining his voice and pointed to the marble door in the backgrond. "If you're so strong, how did you open and close that seemingly unopenable door?"

Beliamon gave him a dry look.

"Your current digivolutions, Lobomon and KendoGarurumon ae both weak in darkness, while I'm strong in it. Not to mention, while I'm at champion level, I can easily defeat an Angewoman. If I digivolve I can even hold my own with a Royal Knight. And I didn't use that door, it's been sealed since the destruction Ayzahn Ra, the village this temple resided in. I used the skylight." Beliamon pointed out.

Kouji once again examined the light filtering down from the skylight, the gears in his head turning again.

"Oh, and by the way," Beliamon chimed in. "Don't think of escaping through there either. I've magicked the opening to act as a forcefield, as while we can see out, no one else can see in. It also masks the smoke from fires we would light.

Kouji turned back to her and scowled at having his plan put out so early. Beliamon chcukled at the look on his face and threw something to him, which out of reflex he caught.

It was a cooked meat apple.

"I already cooked it. you can snack on it while I get Dinner ready." Belaimon stated.

Kouji licked his lips in temptation, but laid the apple down beside of him and crossed his arms.

"I don't accept food from kidnappers." He said icily.

"Well you might as well," Beliamon huffed, putting her hands on her hips. "There's no telling on how long you'll be here with me, though its more likely to be longer than shorter, and it looks like you've done a good job of feeding youself so far."

Beliamon giggled as Kouji gasped and realized the whole time he had been 'chatting' with Beliamon, his shirt had ridden up and had been displaying the slight roll of flab recently added to his formerly fit frame.

Turning scarlet, he hastily pulled his shirt back down to hide his paunch as Beliamon continued to giggle as she walked down one of the passageways and her voice echoed throughtout the cave.

"It's really nothing to worry about, Kouji. From what I understand of the Real World, a lot of kids are becoming fatter. Its not so uncommon. Some people even prefer being plus sized! You'll grow into it!" Beliamon laughed at her joke as she continued down the passageway.

Still a bit embarassed, and keeping a check on his shirt, Kouji wondered about his captor. She had kidnapped him, and was apperently working for Cherubimon, but she didn't really seem evil. She seemed quite bubbly sometimes, like Takuya and Zoe, but like himself, he felt a great sadnes within her. She could also be serious, and yet sarcastic, and she also emanated power. He estimated she could hold her own against any of Cherubimon's Warriors and that her claims of power were true.

Absentmindely, Kouji wondered what he was going to do until he was rescued....

IF he was rescued.

Growing bored with the room, and wanting to keep an eye on his 'host', Kouji deliberated on whether or not he should follow her, as he could still hear her footsteps faintly and the rustle of her unique dress. Weighing the two choices quickly, Kouji decided to...
1341.title: Kouji Meets Beliamon

choices: He decides to go into the kitchen after all.
Beliamon brings him his dinner any way.
13412.content:
Kouji decided to wait until his captor returned from doing whatever she was really doing. Beliamon had told him that she departed to make dinner, but Kouji suspected something much more sinister. In fact, Kouji believed that all he would really get for dinner was the white meat apple that she had tossed him before- the same meat apple gleamed innocently and sat directly across from him as he looked at it with great discern.

If only he had his digivice, then he could escape and return back to the others. Unfortunately, accessing the powers of his digivice wasn't going to be an option for the near future... Perhaps Beliamon had implied that she had it with her, and maybe then he could try and take it from her at night.

Kouji shook his head. There was no way he could count on such a half-baked plan. Beliamon had mentioned that darkness was her specialty, and more than likely, she could catch him in the act before he was even close to reclaiming his precious digivice. That was exactly what Takuya would have done, but at least he would have tried something.

There wasn't very much to see up in the skylight- not much, except to simply observe that it was starting to get dark out.

"I must have been out longer than I thought," Kouji grumbled to himself as he tried to stretch his stiff joints. Theoretically, if he was taken by Beliamon when he was asleep last night, then he would have woken up normally by morning, but here he was just awoken at about late afternoon by his guesses. It could only have been Beliamon's spells that put him in such long a sleep.

A loud churning, grumble came from deep within... not the caves, but Kouji's belly.

Now he felt that if there was one thing he needed, it would definitely be food. His stomach growling made him look back to the meat apple, which was directly in front of him, unmoving and unyielding and utterly appealing to the eye. It was smooth, solid, and a glossy, pale white- it could have just as well been made of ivory if he didn't know.

He remembered the first time he had meat apples. Bokumon had explained, as always, that when cooked, the snow colored apples took on the flavor of a meat... but what meat it tasted like was random and a complete suprise to the one who tasted it.

Kouji turned his thoughts away from the meat apple- he had to, it was just too tempting. There was no way Kouji would accept Beliamon's food. She had kidnapped him and was holding him hostage- why would he ever give himself over to her?

Why would he ever accept any gifts from her? That would just prove that he was weak. That's the last thing he wanted her to think, that he was just some little weakling that could be easily held hostage and taken care of. He had to put up some struggle against her and stand strong! He had to fight that temptation!

The boy in blue peered down a long, dark, cave passage. He took note that this was not the one that Beliamon had ventured down. What if he went down that mysterious passage? Where would he end up going? Perhaps to a way out, to freedom, and to his friends... or perhaps he would end up getting himself lost in a multi-layed labyrinth of catacombs that crumble and collapse ever so easily- then, almost instantaneously, he would find a quick and early grave... And even if he found a way out, the outside might be a complete wasteland or empty, dusty plain- like Beliamon said, even the Trailmon hadn't found their way here... and it all seemed hopeless... and now Kouji faced dealing with a sense of defeat, that he would have to deal with Beliamon's whims possibly forever.

While he was lamenting over his no-win scenario and sunk hopes, his mind zig-zagged and sidetracked back over to a familiar fruit.

"I wonder what flavor it really is?" he asked himself as he caught himself reaching forward to the meat apple. Quickly, he retracted his hand as if it had just touched upon a hot iron, shocked at himself. Was he that weak? He wanted to slap that reaching hand so much...

What was he thinking?

He had almost submitted himself over to that tempting present, that devious meat apple. He had almost given in to the alluring, tantalizing sensation of...

His stomach growled, groaned, and even started to pain him a little... He was starving! This was absolute torture to behold! It was horrible, and that terrible Beliamon had planned it all- she knew he would drive himself crazy over it, but when she threw it to him, it didn't seem that way. She tossed it to him lightly, almost without a second thought...

Well, he still wouldn't let himself be such a pushover... but he couldn't help but wonder if it was gingered pork, his favorite- it had always been one of his most favored of dinners and it also happened to be the flavor of his first meat apple: ginger pork, a combination of words that made his mouth water.

Suddenly, a thought came across his mind...

There was one instance he could think of- one instance only, where he could eat the meat apple, and it would be perfectly acceptable and understandable, but itwould only be in an emergency.

If Beliamon ended up abandoning him in the cave, then it would be alright for him to eat the apple, he guessed. You see, if she left him there to starve, then it would be a matter of survival. Yes, she could have been merely toying with him before...

Kouji then remembered something else- meat apples taste horrible if raw. Now he wondered if meat apples got this way if they cooled off for too long... and there was just only one way to find out.

He tried to stop himself, but then he realized that nobody was really there to stop him or even notice for that matter- besides, it was just a measly meat apple, and he was simply making a big deal about it all.

Leaning over from his crosslegged position, Kouji quickly snatched the meat apple into his grasp. He sighed to himself in pleasure and relief when he found it still warm. Then, after turning it over and around in his hands a few times, he contemplated a bit, but then took a big mouthful out of it.

Instantly, his mouth flooded with the sweet flavor of warm gingered pork- it was just too good to be true! His body swarmed with energy and increased strength as he savored the taste. It was all too good, and only a moment later he swallowed reluctantly. He looked around cautiously to make sure that nobody was looking, and then he took another bite greedily, then another, and another. He was pretty hungry, after all, and although he was content for the moment, he still had to admit he was a little hungry.

Then, hiding the meat apple core where nobody could find it, in a large crevice in the cave wall, Kouji returned to the same position he was sitting in and continued to sit for a long while. At least he was content, but he prayed that Beliamon wouldn't find out... maybe it wouldn't be as big a deal to her, though, Kouji thought again.

And so, Kouji continued to wait... and wait... and wait, in that same cross-legged position with his head down. After a while, a familiar voice and figure became apparent.

"... you just won't give up, will you? I'm telling you, you're so stubborn..." came the voice of Beliamon as she emerged from the shadows.

Kouji glared up at her but said nothing.

"Well, I hate to say it, but I've been here watching you for quite a while," Beliamon stated, "And you haven't moved since.

Kouji grew a little nervous that she might have seen him pigging out on the meat apple, weakly giving into temptation, much unlike the Warrior of Light she took him to be.

"The dinner's only going to get cold, you know," Beliamon murmured.

So she had cooked dinner after all, Kouji thought with optimism. Lowering his vision from her, Kouji muttered, "I'm sorry, but I can't accept your food."

Beliamon placed her hands on her hips and looked worried, "You're so stubborn!" she exclaimed, "Loosen up a little or you just might starve yourself to death- I didn't poison anything, for your information."

Hmm, poison, Kouji didn't think of that yet...

Kouji didn't reply, but rather gave an icy stare in response.

"And I spent all that time... Why don't you just follow me into the kitchen? I'm sure I made at least one thing you like- maybe you'll like my food as much as you did that meat apple," she grinned.

Kouji jerked nervously, blushed vividly, and felt like he was about to puke. So she had seen him.

Quickly pulling himself together, Kouji muttered, "Yeah, well... go ahead, I'll get up and see you there when I see you, when I feel like it."

"You know..." Beliamon remarked before turning around to return to the kitchen, "I'm sorry, but I have a bad feeling that you'll be sitting there feeling sorry for yourself all night long. That's just fine by me if you want to be that way," she huffed as she sashayed down the passage, her dress audibly russling against the floor, "I'll be in the kitchen if you admit you need anything."

Kouji continued to sit, his legs falling asleep, and his mind a little befuddled.
13412.title: Kouji's Temptation

134122.content:
'That stupid little brat! I worked so hard on cooking him an actual dinner when I could have just magicked one and that's the thanks I get. I should just poison him, Cherubimon would be just as happy...'

These thoughts whirled through Beliamon's head as she furiously stomped her way back to the kitchen, fully intent on letting him starve.

"Although..." Beliamon bit her lip. "I would get in trouble for not following Cherubimon's orders...and I can't afford provoking his wrath now..."

Beliamon paused a moment and shivered a bit.

"No....not now or not ever again..." She muttered, quickly picking up her pace again to prevent certain memories coming to her that she didn't want to remember.

Finally returning to the kitchen, she eyed the wonderful, delicious, delectible dinner that she had COOKED, to only have Kouji refuse: Several helpings of roast beef, flavored with saffron and ginseng, an ample serving of mashed potatoes, several rolls with butter, a tankard of frosty milk, and a small sized sundae. The meal, wasn't perfect, but again Beliamon hadn't used her magic. If she had, she could have made a meal twenty times as better and fifty times as tasty as the one before her.

The kitchen, though still natural, was a bit more modernized than the room Kouji was in, what she called the common room. The walls here were made of a blue stone instead of brown and a skylight let light drift down into the room, and like the one in the common room, as well as all the other skylights in the temple, this one had been magicked to prevent intrusion or escape. Littered around the room were several structures that looked like kitchen appliances, fashioned out of a black stone. Long ago, Beliamon had learned that the Mages of this temple had commisioned some artisan digimon in the far south to make appliances for them so they would not have to venture out of the temple for food. That had been when Beliamon was still classified as an 'in-training' digimon, and when Ayzahn Ra and this temple had still been flourishing. Amazingly, the appliances still worked and the Mages had left great stores of food behind, magicked to prevent spoiling. Also in the room were a 'table and chairs' similar to the ones in the common room, but smaller. Also, like the common room, several other pasageways branched off of the kitchen.

After she had finished the meal, she had magicked it to keep what should have been hot, hot, and what should have been cold, cold, to observe her captive.

She had been delighted when he had caved into his cravings for the meat apple, but her good mood had been nigh eliminated when he refused to come eat his dinner.

Sighing, Beliamon again glanced at the food before her and contemplated a bit. Rolling her eyes, she decided that she might as well take his food to him. He WAS going to eat, sooner or later. He wasn't just about to let himself starve, unless he wanted to eat the occasional bug crawling across the floor, and she wasn't about to let him get thin again and have his way with her. If she didn't feed him, he was liable to lose all the weight he'd already acquired.

Eventually, he'd start eating more, and hopefully, he'd open up to her. That's when he would willingly eat whatever she gave to him.

Her mood lifting a bit, she put all of the food on a tray and levitated it beside herself and she quickly walked back towards the common room.

Surprisingly, Kouji wasn't in the same position she'd left him in, but what she saw made her blood boil: He'd left the comfort of his straw bed and was on the floor a few feet away struggling to do some sit-ups.

Immeadiately, she pranced over to his position and hoisted him off of the ground. He was red in the face and beginning to sweat and his shirt had once hiked up during his exercise. At first startled by Beliamon and her angry expression and the tray of food hovering next to her, his face quickly formed a scowl.

"May I ask what you were doing?" Belimon asked, her anger obvious but controlled.

Kouji snorted ans crossed his arms.

"Not that its nay of your business, but as you pointed out earlier, I'm getting fat and I was trying to lose the extra pounds I'd gained." He explained.

"You will NOT do any exercise while you are MY prisoner."

"And WHY not?"

Beliamon almost blurted out 'Because you're supposed to be GAINING weight.', but bit her tongue. Calming herself, she quickly thought up an excuse.

"Because you havn't eaten anything. If you don't eat, you'll run out of energy. Not to mention the floor of this temple is rough. You'll hurt yourself. From now on, I forbid any exercise at all." Belaimon said regally while pushing Kouji back to his 'bed'.

"And if I don't listen?" Kouji taunted.

Beliamon's eyes darkened and Kouji felt a wave of power rush out from her. She smirked as she liad the tray of food on his lap.

"DO you really want to know?" She asked playfully.

Kouji just glared at her, and then the food.

"I told you I'm not eating anything you give me." He remarked.

Beliamon gave him a withering look and sighed, pinching a small piece of roast beef and poppin it into her mouth.

"See, its not poisonous." She tried to ease his worry.

"What about the other food?" Kouji questioned, still suspicious.

Her eyebrow started to tick in irritation but Beliamon quickly sampled a bit of all of the other food on Kouji's plate, making sure he saw her chew and swallow.

Kouji again glanced the food for a moment, and back to her.

"How can I be sue you not just immune to whatever you put in it?" He asked again.

Beliamon growled in annoyance at Kouji's five-hundrendth question and bent down to come an inch form his face.

"I assure you that I did not in any way, shape, or form poison ro tamper with your food," She assured, a vein visible on her forehead. "Now will you please just eat!?"

Kouji's eyes widened at her outburst, but again looked at the food. She felt a small glimmer of satisfaction when she saw him lick his lips. He looked back and forth between her and the food a few mometns before sighing in defeat.

"There's not enough light." HE said matter-of-factly.

A smile coming to her lips, Beliamon waved her hand and a fire appeared in the pit under the skylight behing Kouji. She laughed a bit when he jumped at the sudden light and noise of the fire.

"H-how did you do that!?" He asked in bewilderment as Beliamon took a seat in the floor across from him. "I thought you said that your powers were derived from Darkness!"

Beliamon shrugged.

"I said my specialty was Darkness. I can do other magic and draw power from other elements as well. I told you that I used to live in the village beyond this cave of a temple, a village of quite powerful mages. I learned most of my magic, there." She said simply.

Oh...I see." Was all Kouji said as he poked his food, and the two sat in relative silence for a while, with only the occasional sound from deeper within the temple to keep them company.

"I thought you said the floor was uncomfortable?" Kouji asked after a while.

"I'm not sitting."

Kouji looked at her strangely for a moment before she realized she was levitating just an inch or so off of the ground.

Flabbergasted, Kouji almost choked on a piece of roast beef. Beliamon giggled as she waited for him to right himself.

You really must be powerful. Most digimon, to my knowledge, don't have those types of abilities, and most have to shout the names of their attacks." Kouji replied, a thoughtful look on his face.

Beliamon nodded, an almost sad look to her face.

"In Ayzahn Ra, there were many more powerful digimon than I....but yes, if I used an actual attack, it would be more powerful. I cna't just use them any time, though. They take a lot of energy, physical and magical. I can't use hem like I use my normal magic." She explained.

So there's no limit to the type of magic yu're using now?" Kouji asked in wonder.

Beliamon chuckled.

"No, of course not. Everything has it limits, magic included. And everything...has an end..." Beliamon trailed off a sad look once again in her eyes.

The two once sat again in silence, and Kouji watched Belimaon with that look till present in her eyes. Finally, he decided to break the silence with a question.

You said that my friends or even Trailmon couldn't get here, why is that?" He asked.

Beliamon jumped, snapped out of her reverie, and looked at Kouji suspiciously for a moment before coming to the decision that it was safe to tell him.

On your ventures across the Digital World, you've came across a few areas like bottomless pits have you not?" She questioned.

Kouji nodded.

"These are ares in which the data that compromised them had been completely detroyed or absorbed by Cherubimon or his followers." She explained as Kouji gasped.

"We...knew that he was gathering data from Digimon...", Kouji murmured, shocked. "But not from the very Digital World itself..."

Beliamon nodded sadly and continued her explanation.

"Ayzahn Ra, the surrounding area, and this temple, The Temple of Earth, if you're wondering, that's why its so like a cave, it was built onto one; are all that's not been absorbed in this area. Now what's left is like an island in a sea of nothingness." Belimaon said quietly, higginh her knees to herself.

"Then...how did you get here?" Kouji asked.

"I used a teleportation spell. I could've flown, but the flight is quite tiring and many weaker digimon coudn't make it." Beliamon elaborated.

Another small silence.

"You said Temple of Earth..." Kouji muttered, a spark of an idea forming in his mind.

Beliamon smiled and nodded.

"Yes...surrounding Ayzahn Ra there were once nine other temples, dedicated to the elemenst of the Ten Legendary Warriors. Ayzahn Ra was a village of mage digimon dedicated to these elements in both Magic and Physical Combat...but all the other temples and digimon were destroyed when their data was absrorbed." Beliamon said, a sad smile on her lips.

Kouji gazed at the strange digimon that had captured him. It was clear that she carried a great sorrow in her heart and a great burden in her soul, but he could also sense she was not telling him something. He almost felt sorry for her, but he was still light years from trusting her, or even liking her, but she had some of his respect...some, not all. After all, she HAD kidnapped him.

"I'm done." Kouji said simply and pushed the tray away.

Beliamon glanced at the tray, then him, and scowled. HE hadn't eaten very much, though he had taken a large chunk out of the sundae. It appeared that Kouji had a sweet tooth.

Beliamon stored that fact in her mind for future use and got up to return the tray to the kitchen, guessing that this was as much Kouji would eat...for now at least.

"Well, I'll return this to the kitchen. If I were you, I'd get some sleep. Its gotten quite late since you woke up earlier this afternoon." She commented as she entered the passageway.

Despite, being under Belimon's speel earlier, Kouji did feel a bit sleepy and curled up into his bed; it was actually quitr comfy.

Right before he feel asleep, he heard Beliamon's giggles echoing through the passageways of the Temple of Earth...

The next morning...
134122.title: Beliamon's Home Cooked Meal

choices: A bright and somewhat eager looking Beliamon
1341221.content:
Kouji's icy eyes snapped open, glittering and shimmering somehow in the very dim light, reacting to the sound, or lack there of, around him.

There was nothing, really, nothing at all was alive around him. There should have been the occasional rat or bug scampering about the cave floor, but now, in the cavern room he was in, there was nothing but silence.

The warm, dancing flames of the fire pit had long since gone out, but in the back of his mind, Kouji wondered if the flames were really eternal and would just go on forever and Beliamon had to cause them to extinguish. Now, as a result, it was just a little too cool for Kouji's comfort. Kouji had to huddle up and bury his pale hands in his pocket.

He looked up at the skylight to observe an ashen gray cast sky. Not a cloud was up there, it was all uniform and bland. Kouji wondered and began to doubt that the skies were like that every day when the now-ruined city, Amon Ra, or whatever Beliamon had called it, was flourishing.

Kouji felt sleep pulling at his conciousness again, much to his annoyance. It might have been the only quirk his sleep patterns had: some days he would sleep perfectly, but on some nights, usually on those when he was somewhat distressed, he would wake up involuntarily at the heart of night or a waking twilight hour and stay awake for about an hour. He would start contemplating and worrying, only to fall asleep and forget it all, even after he had woken up.

For about an hour, Kouji napped on and off. If Takuya or J.P. were here, he could just look at their wristwatches and figure out what time it was. It felt like three o'clock to him, but with that sky neither bright nor dark, there was no way of telling.

During that hour, Kouji could feel the room begin to warm up, and warm mist and fog began to pour from the skylight. It was at this time when Kouji arose from his straw bed, holding himself up and straightening his back with two hands while he lay his feet out, sprawling apart.
He was fairly confident that his friends would come and rescue him- not that Kouji needed any rescuing in the first place, he was just fine by himself, could probably find a way out of this sticky situation all by himself, and would find his way back all by himself... well, at least, that's what Kouji wanted to think.

Long, drawn out yawns filled Kouji's mouth as he started to lay back down, his hands resting on his stomach. The boy in blue started to frown down on himself.

"Well, you really did dig in last night, Kouji," he whispered regretfully to himself.

"And you really shouldn't have," he told himself.

"And if she came in her today with a frying pan and offered you a heaping breakfast, would you be able to resist?" he asked himself, hoping to find the answer himself.

He felt really bad that he had caved in last night, although he HAD shown some moderation and didn't scarf down the whole meal- at least he had given resistance towards his odd captor.

"And now you're sorry?" Kouji smirked at his own feelings. Suddenly, his nerves gave way with a loud rumble from the belly. A reluctant smile crept up his face which soon loosed and widened with glee as it took form. Soon he was in food fantasy...

"And you know just as well as I that it was so goood..." Kouji sighed with delight. He continued to grin, as his eyes closed and he descended into a dreamlike table full of delectables.

As Kouji turned his head in his half-sleep, a stray strand of straw tickled his nose and caused his eyes to snap open for the second time this morning- in a matter of seconds, Kouji was out of his self-induced trance.

He was upset with himself for being hungry, but Kouji couldn't blame himself. It was just a natural thing. People DO get hungry if they don't eat properly, after all. However, he had to look at the facts cut and dry:

He had already accepted Beliamon's first meal, now he faced the problem of drawing the line. Kouji didn't want to die of starvation, but he didn't want to trust Beliamon either. Besides, he was starting to put on a little bit too much weight for his own comfort recently. Perhaps he would eat just the crusts and crumbs- the bare bones, what he needed, and just enough to survive.

Kouji decided not to pry any deeper into his thoughts. Sleep was starting to return to him; he just needed to give it a rest.

Kouji shuddered at his own pun.

He had a feeling he wouldn't wake up until morning (which would hopefully be a little warmer), maybe he'd sleep in some... although he had a faint hunch that sleeping in could only be a wistful thought and he'd be woken up again sooner or later by the only other resident of the temple.

Sure enough, Kouji could only enjoy a few more hours of sleep, because about an hour after sunrise, his slumbered was abruptly terminated by...
1341221.title: Twilight Thoughts

choices: Beliamon had entered the room again?
13412211.content:
Kouji blinked sleepily at the one who woke him, before yawning and stretching, and then glaring.

Though, he had been up just a scant few hours ago, Kouji was still quite sleepy, and he was definately not a person.

In response to Beliamon's bright and sunny exterior, Kouji rolled over and attempted to go back to sleep.

Beliamon's smile and happy aura immeadiately left her and she glared at Kouji's back.

"And this is how you act to the one who feeds you?" Fine. No breakfast for you." Beliamon atttempted scolding Kouji.

Kouji, showing no inclination as to getting up, waved a hand in the air as if to dismiss her.

"Fine with me. If yo've forgotten, I STILL don't trust you. Plus, I'm getting fat anyway. I need to lose some weight, especiialy after how I pigged out last night." Kouji stated.

'That was pigging out?' Beliamon thought to herself. 'Then I have more work to do than I originally thought...'

Instead of voicing her thought, however, Beliamon simply crossed her arms and decided to taunt Kouji.

"Why worry about your weight now? YOu certainly weren't before I 'abducted' you? It was almost as if you were TRYING to get fat.

That caught Kouji's attention and, his temper flared, he turned to glare at his captor.

"What!? Why would I want to become fat?!" He exclaimed.

Beliamon inwardly smirked as her taunt produced the desired effect and she feigned a look of surprise.

"Oh, well from what I've heard of the real world, many children are putting on weight-"

"And where would you hear such things?"

"Before Ayzahn Ra was destroyed, a powerful clan of fire digimon watched over the Temple of Fire. Their leader was Agumon, and while only at Rookie level, had once held the form of WarGreymon, a Mega level, and had supposedly travelled with a human to the real world long ago. He told me a story once of how many of the children there seemed to be getting larger."

The story was true. When Beliamon had been but in her In-Training form, she had heard the tale from Agumon, who had travelled with the children known as the Digidestined long ago and was renowned throught Ayzahn Ra for his storytelling skills.

And believing her story, Kouji's teeth were clenched in frustration and he glared at the ground.

"Well, I suppose that thats true...the precentage of overweight children in most modern nations has increased the past few years, but Japan's nothing compared to America! And even so, that's no reason for ME to get fat!" Kouji grumbled.

In response, Beliamon only chuckled and conjured a breakfast for her captive while he was destracted and sat down acroos from him on the floor with the food on a tray in her lap, much like the previous night, in hopes he would eat while talking to her.

As she placed the tray of food, a generous helping of bacon and eggs, some french toast, a blueberry muffin, and a tall glass of orange juice,a relatively tiny breakfast, on Kouji's own lap(producing a wide-eyed look from the blue-haired boy), she decided to press the subject more.

"I still don't see why it would be so awful, your friends were gaining weight as well. Especially the one who holds the Spirits of Fire, what was his name again?"

"Where did THIS come from?!" Kouji ignored her question and pointed at the delectible breakfast on his lap.

"It was here all along, you just didn't notice. Now eat and answer the question." Beliamon lied.

"Huh?...Oh! You mean Takuya." At the memory of his friend, Kouji laughed, absentmindedly taking a bite of the blueberry muffin.

"So that's his name. Well, he was putting on weight as well, about at your pace, and he seemed rather content."

At that Kouji chuckled, now chewing on a strip of bacon as beliamon watched him carefully, excited at how her plan was working.

"You obviously don't know Takuya. From what he's told me, he plays soccer back in the Real World, he's a really active guy...but then again he's also got a really active apetite. I also hear that his mom is like, afraid of fat."

"Then how could he possibly gain weight while travelling all over the Digital World, locked in a battle with the Dark Lord Cherubimon?" Beliamon asked a bit dramatically.

Kouji blushed a bit at this,stopping mid-chew on a piece of frecnh toast, as beliamon waited for him to say what she already knew.

"Well...um, you see these past few weeks, there really hasn't been anything for us to be active about. We just made camp in this grove of meat apples until we got any leads on Cherubimon. So we were there, in a grove of very delicious meat apples and I guess we just started to chow down..." Kouji mumbled, putting a hand to his stomach.

"Unfortuantely, as a result we also started packing on the pounds.."

It was then that several things happened. Kouji, reminded about his recent weight increase, had realized he had been eating ANOTHER meal from his captor, a quite fattening one at that, and it was at this time Belimaon cackled, picking up the almost finished breakfast from Kouji's lap, satisfied with herself.

Recovering, Kouji glared at the dark digimon.

"You...you tricked me!" He exclaimed, pointing a finger at Beliamon, now towering over him.

In response, she once again feigned surprise and put her free hand on her hip.

"Oh! You caught me! They call you Sherlock where you come from?" She taunted with a sarcastic remark as she sat the tray on one of the table-like rock formations.

Kouji's response was a glare.

"Are you TRYING to make me fat?" He asked her with venom dripping from his voice.

Beliamon chuckled to herself. If only Kouji knew how right he was.

Instead, she sat back down across from the pony-tailed boy and gave him a sympathetic look.

"I just want you to eat. You have to eat something to survive. You really should stop worrying about getting fat. And even if you were to add a few pounds here and there would it be so terrible? What's so bad about being fat?" Beliamon questioned her prisoner.

A moment or two, fire danced within Kouji's eyes as he continued to glare at her, but he surprised her when a sad look came over his features and he glanced down at the ground.

"Kouji?" She ventured, wondering why the sudden change in his behavior.

Immeadiately, the fire was back in his eyes and Kouji's fists clenched as he glared at Beliamon.

"Its nothing. I just want to get out of this stupid cave or temple or whatever, get back to my friends, and, most of all, GET AWAY FROM YOU." He shouted harshly, causing Beliamon to wince.

A hurt look in her eyes, Beliamon said nothing as she rose regally, took the tray with the remains of Kouji's breakfast, and left down a corridor, without even a backaward glance at the miffed Holder of Light.

Kouji glared at her retreating form. Past his emotions, he knew he shoudn't have shouted at the human looking digimon. He knew she was a lonely soul, much like himself, but she had captured him, taunted him about his recent weight gain, tricked him into eating far larger servings than he would normally eat of quite fattening foods, probably making him gain MORE weight, and had almost caused some painful memories to resurface.

Trying to calm himself, Kouji decided to glare at a wall.

He was able to do so for about a few minutes before being driven out of his mind with boredom.

'What does she expect me to do for the other 23 hours left in the day?' Kouji sarcastically thought, rolling his eyes.

Trying to pass the time, he tried to think of his friends. He wondered what they were doing now.

Kouji smiled at the thought.

He could imagine them all. Tommy in his large hat, chasing after bugs in a field. JP professing his love for Zoe. ZOe knocking JP out. Takuya taking a large bite out of a meat apple and rubbing his stomach, smiling cheekily.

Kouji's smile fell, replaced with a frown.

The thought of Takuya rubbing his stomach reminded Kouji of his weight problem, his hand moving to his now full stomach.

He supposed that it woudn't be ALL bad if he was fat....he just didn't want to be the odd one out in the group.

Sure, JP was fat, but JP was jolly and funny and had his jokes. Kouji's personality wasn't suited to be fat. It wouldn't be so bad if the whole group were fat, though...

Kouji blinked realizing what he had just thought. He woudn't wish obesity on his friends! Kouji shook his head as if to clear it.

Sighing, Kouji decided to try to go back to sleep as he lied down back onto his bed. He would just have to eat less, and watch out for Beliamon.

Kouji then closed his eyes and cleared his mind of thoughts, trying to pass the long day. It was when he was almost asllep that a sound surprised him, causing him to sit up...
13412211.title: Breakfast Time

134122112.content:
A piercing scream echoed throughout the hollow halls and still air of the Temple of Earth. Kouji's back bolted upright out of his straw bed and he gasped, a chilling sensation of fear and sudden awareness taking hold of his body. His eyes snapped open, and he took in the daylight of the afternoon. The dark waters of great apprehension began to flood his mind, and this showed in his eyes as he hastily rose to his feet.

He had just woke up, and his throat and mouth were dry and it was as if they were coated with some thick sort of batter. Strangely, even though he had only been sleeping on straw on the floor, his back didn't feel cramped up in any way. In fact, it felt relaxed, as if he had been resting on the softest of mattresses.

When the wrenching sound reached his ears and reverberated over and over again, softer and softer down the halls, Kouji felt the urge from deep down inside of him to hurry up. With each passing repercussion of a past cry, cold drops of sweat silently crept down his body as made a tight knot in his stomach as it pained him a little. Kouji's hair must have started to stand on end just a little.

Kouji fearfully knew that it could only be Beliamon, the one other person... the only other in the Temple... or was she?

His mind still churning from waking up, Kouji didn't stop to contemplate the issue any more. He was on his feet and Kouji was pacing rapidly down the dark brown-tinged alleys, and Kouji secretly hoped he was heading down the direction where the cry had originated from.

Beliamon had just screamed, and Kouji knew it wasn't merely one made out of frustration from his behavior.

The echoes had faded so much now that Kouji could barely hear them, and now the only thing Kouji could hear was his own heavy breaths and footsteps. He was sprinting down the hallway now, as fast as he could muster, fatigue already beginning to take its toll on his body. He could even feel his small paunch bobble up and down in turn with his lunging strides. Hot beads of sweat from excercise started to join the cold ones formed by fear. It was getting terribly dark down in the cave halls, and Kouji hoped and prayed desperately that he hadn't become lost in the tangling web of halls throughout the Temple of Earth. He had only made a few turns, and he had at one point a hopeful feeling that he would find Beliamon's location...

Where ever she was... Kouji felt his fists tighten as he turned around and started to run faster down the tunnel, searching new pathways frantically with a dire newfound vigor.

Was she in danger?

What would he do if she was?

Was he too late?

...Then what would happen to him?

Making a sharp turn into a large yet unforseen hallway and making an entrance into a large chamber, Kouji gasped for the second time that day.

He felt tension build up in his body. His face felt warm and flushed. Kouji couldn't help it at all.

"Beliamon!" he called out, his voice echoing through the caves just as the scream had as he continued to search the caves.

***

"Kouji!" Neemon called out into the thick overgrowth of field and trees that surrounded the meat apple grove. The sounds of wings flapping and twigs breaking filled the air as few birdlike Digimon frantically burst out of the nests and trees in which they had been sleeping in response to Neemon's screeching calls. Once the birds had took to the air, a still silence distilled itself again over the thick brush of the forest.

"Oh, give it a rest, already," Bokumon scolded, grabbing his red suspender clad companion and dragging him back to the grove where the others had formed a circle around a former campfire ground.

After a full, fruitless, futile day of searching in the surrounding grounds and calling out for Kouji, the children were both exhausted and feeling a bit disheartened in their attempts. Tommy had almost ended up getting lost himself in the woods while looking for Kouji by himself the other day. Kouji hadn't responded to any of the messages they had sent to him via digivice, which was strange because Kouji was generally good about making detailed replies to any messages sent to him.

"Where could he have gone off to?" Takuya scowled, kicking at an ashen log from last night's fire, "I mean, it's not like him just to run off like that."

"You wouldn't have said that a few months ago," Zoe responded.

"What?" Takuya looked astonished as he blinked slowly with his mouth hanging open widely, "No, I wouldn't!" he protested almost automatically.

"Yeah, you would," Zoe insisted, crossing her arms, "Kouji used to always leave us and journey on his own for a while."

"Now that you bring it up..." JP nodded, "That does seem like something Kouji might have done a while ago... but back then, we didn't really know him that well."

"Maybe he got tired of just sitting around doing nothing," Tommy suggested.

"Nothing but eating," Takuya smirked, standing up with a sly face, rubbing his chin, "I think that's pretty smart of him, then. I bet he though if he went on a really long hike, he'd drop all the pounds he put on, so when he comes back, he'll be the slim, healthy one."

"Well, Takuya, it would all do us well to lose a few pounds," Zoe added before allowing herself to fall back onto the ground, relaxing on the wide spread of green grass.

Tommy sighed, hanging his head low, "I hope he comes back soon. I hope nothing bad's happened to him..."

"Wouldn't he be back by now even if he was on a hike?" JP asked, "I mean, how long can it possibly take?"

"Isn't it possible he might have recieved a message from Ophanimon on his digivice on the night he disappeared and has to go somewhere," Zoe proposed.

"So he just runs off without telling us?" JP questioned, "That sounds pretty irresponsible."

"Maybe it was a secret message, or a mission that only Kouji can know about," Zoe shrugged as she looked up at the clouds.

"What if he got hurt in the woods?" Tommy sighed curtly, "What if he needs help?"

"Well, we searched the woods all over yesterday. It's not a very big area, and if he was stuck, wouldn't he have called back when we called his name?" Takuya said.

"Yeah, and even if our buddy, Kouji, was in trouble outside the forest, he'd still be able to let us know by sending us a message with his digivice," JP added.

"So maybe he just wants to be left alone for a while... and knowing Kouji, that doesn't seem odd at all," Takuya said.

"But we can't just lounge about like this forever," Tommy cried, "Especially with Kouji gone. Maybe he..." Tommy sniveled slightly, "Maybe he needs our help."

"Well, we should stay here for one more night at least so he knows where to find us," Zoe nodded, "But Tommy's right. Maybe Kouji was kidnapped."

"If that's the case, then we're really in trouble," JP said cautiously, a small glint of fright in his eyes, "And again, if that's the case, I think I know who may be behind it all."

"Cherubimon," Takuya stated, spitting out the name like venom, "Alright, so we'll stay here one more night and continue to send him messages on our digivices. If he doesn't return by then... well, then we've got a problem on our hands... We have to leave the meat apple grove soon, though. Too much time's gone by," he smiled, patting his slightly larger gut.

"But where will we start to look if he doesn't show up?" Zoe asked.

"I guess we should start to look for clues and ask around... maybe we'll have to split up to cover more area- into teams, of course. We don't all want to get lost," Takuya said, "But in the meantime... I think a little more lunch isn't going to hurt."

The others sighed and rolled their eyes. Takuya would never know how much good leaving the meat apple grove would do to his figure. It was just too tempting for him.

***

"Hold still," Kouji instructed warily, his voice shaky and nervous as cold sweat dripped down his back. In his hands, he held a white, porcelein vase filled with cool water he had found in a basin and a damp cloth bandage.

"I am..." an irritated Beliamon who was in pain grumbled, sighing through clenched teeth, "You should really steady your own hand if you must insist on-"

"Don't worry, I can do this..." Kouji sighed, attempting to examine the damage on her upper arm. Quickly, Beliamon draped a fold of the black dress she was wearing over the area.

The digimon who was holding Kouji captive started to blush, "I would prefer it if I treated myself," she said stiffly, discomfort very apparent in her face.

Kouji humphed and crossed his arms while giving Beliamon an icy glare. Even though he probably despised her above all else, Kouji still felt compelled and wanting to help his injured captor. From what he gathered, Beliamon had been cooking dinner and something ended up burning her upper arm, what exactly, she declined to say. Kouji guessed scalding water could have burst out and landed on her arm, or maybe she had slipped and her arm briefly touched upon a hot cooking surface.

He couldn't just leave her like that... Kouji noted that now Beliamon's eyes were closed tight and she seemed to be in a lot of pain.

He remembered the long summer he had spent at summer camp a year ago. Every day, from dawn to dusk, he would go to a different activity or class with a break in between... and every bright morning was spent in a sterile room with an instructor wearing thick glasses. Every morning he had first aid class.

He could understand why Beliamon was resisting his help and attention... if she was his captor, why would she ever submit herself over to her prisoner's care?

"Beliamon... if you can trust me, I can fix up your burn," Kouji explained, struggling for words.

The golden haired looked cautiously at Kouji, her eyes wavering for a moment before she proceeded in removing her sleeve for Kouji. Kouji returned her action with a nod of gratitude.

Upon closely examining her arm, Kouji saw that it was red and blistered instead of the smooth, pale skin like on her other arm. He identified it as being a second degree burn. Carefully, he poured the vase of cold water down the burn area. He didn't immediately see any sinks where he could run cold water over her burn, so he quickly decided that it would have to suffice.

Within moments, Kouji had Beliamon's arm bandaged up, "That should be good for about a day-"

"I wouldn't worry about it," Beliamon smiled, leaving her bandage arm free, "I heal quickly."

"Well, uhm you should try to drink a little..." Kouji advised quietly, "So you won't be dehydr..." Kouji stopped and started to turn away. He never really was somebody who reached out to be helpful, but when he sensed someone was in trouble... or if cared for someone, he always tried his hardest to make sure they made it out alright.

Suddenly, Kouji's eyes met Beliamon's. He noticed that they seemed different, somehow... maybe just a glint brighter than before, although he could still detect that she was making an active attempt to conceal the pain from her face, "...Thank you..." she smiled, her voice soft.

"Yeah..." Kouji mumbled, not sure of what to say, knowing that his face was flushed.

"Although, do you have to be so melodramatic with your entrances?" Beliamon chuckled to herself as Kouji's light blush deepened even further.
134122112.title: Screams and Searches

1341221121.content:
Beliamon chuckled openly as Kouji tore into the chicken heaped on to plate, the blue haired boy looking up, his cheeks turning crimson, and rsumed at a more slow and neat pace.

After Kouji had helped Beliamon with her arm, the human-like digimon had practically pushed her captive into the kitchen, saying that if he was so sorry that she had gotten hurt, that he should eat all of his dinner: Some fried chicken, mashed potatoes with gravy, and a few rolls.

After the spat she had had with Kouji earlier, Beliamon had been afraid to push to much food on him, so she had made dinner smaller, and with fairly small portions, but she had been surprised when Kouji had tore into the food like there was no tomorrow.

Watching as Kouji spooned some of the mashed potatoes in her mouth, Beliamon smirked, leaning her head on an elbow.

"And here I thought you didn't trust me." She remarked, to which Kouji shrugged.

"Well, this is the third meal you've given me. I figured if you're going to poison me, you'd have done it already."

"Well what about gaining weight?" Beliamon asked, her eyes widening. She then mentally slapped herself.

Kouji's increasing weight, she had discovered, was NOT a good topic to discuss with the bandanna-wearing boy.

And as she suspected, Kouji immediately stopped eating and his gaze lowered a bit.

"...I really don't have a choice." Kouji said after a moment, making Beliamon's eyes go wide with shock.

She gave him a questioning look, to which he shrugged and resumed eating, though at a slower pace.

"Don't think I'm not going to try my hardest not to, though. I'm still not going to eat ALL of the food you give me, but even with small portions, I'm barely getting any physical activity, if you don't count the little sprint I did earlier when I was "coming to your rescue". I guess the guys will just have to get used to it, when I rejoin them at 300 pounds." Kouji explained, ending with a dark chuckle.

Meanwhile, Beliamon had paled slightly.

'The others...' She thought bleakly, and gulped.

Cherubimon had wanted her to fatten up ALL of the children oppsing him, and even though she and Kouji had talked about his companions a bit, she had completely forgotten that she had to work on them as well.

"Excuse me a moment, Kouji." Beliamon said curtly, earning a curious clance from her prisoner, but was too caught up in his own self-pity at the moment to suspect anything, and resumed eating.

Beliamon then quickly stepped from the kitchen and dining hall area of the Earth Temple to a corridor, making sure she coudn't be seen or heard by Kouji.

Then she concentrated.

Slowly, a ball of violet energy appeared in one of her outstretched hands and slowly began to widen, the center of the sphere becoming clearer and clearer until a picture materialized.

A quick look at the picture, and Beliamon's fears were realized.

The image of the campsite in her palm was a very different one from the campsite she had abducted Kouji from just a day and some odd time ago; everything was packed up and the children were gathered around a campfire, each holding his or her digivice and glancing at it from time to time.

It appeared that they were soon to go searching for their misssing friend. If they were left unnatended and wandered the Digital World, they were sure to lose weight. And that would put Beliamon in a pot of hot water.

The gears in her mind quickly turning, Beliamon forced the energy in her palm to condense, the image of the campsite fading, and opened the energy again, ezcept this time, instead of an image, she pulled forth Kouji's digivice.

Belaimon smirked as she tried to activate the messaging function of the device, probably the only one she could use, before finally finding it.

She had hidden Kouji's digivice where he would have never suspected or been able to look for it: Inside herself.

Placing her thoughts aside, Beliamon then typed up a quick message.

Guys
Needed some time alone. Should be back in a few days. Don’t go anywhere.


Kouji

Closely examining the message a time or two, Beliamon then pressed what she suspected was the send button and made the digivice disappear. She still had a grim look on her face, however.

This was a gamble on her part. On one side, the kids buy her little message and stay in the meat apple grove for a few more days, prolonging and adding to their weight gain, or they realize that the message was a fake, as she didn’t know Kouji’s writing style, track the message and leave the meat apple grove, and try to rescue their abducted companion.

Beliamon hoped and prayed that the second option didn’t play out.

Calming herself down a bit more, Beliamon then re-entered the kitchen to see that Kouji had finished dinner, or finished about half of it, and Kouji was still moping from the last part if their previous conversation.

“Where did you go off to?” Kouji asked, noticing her, his curiosity back for the moment, at least.

“Ah…” Beliamon stuttered. “Potty break.”

“Digimon have to go to the bathroom?” Kouji asked, raising an eyebrow.

“Of course. Digimon may be digital, but we’re still alive, and of course, we have to do things just like you humans do.”

Beliamon then busied herself with taking up the remains of Kouji's dinnner and depositing them in a basin to be cleaned with water later.

That done, she turned back to Kouji and stared at the youth.

"Well....what do you want to do now?" She asked timidly, rubbing her uninjured arm.

Kouji stared at his captor a moment or two and a bead of sweat began to form on the back of his head, and his eyebrow began to tick.

"You captured me and you don't even know what to do with your prisoners EXCEPT feed them?!" He shouted.

In response, Beliamon huffed and put her arms on her hips.

"Well, if I were you, I'd be thankful! I don't know anyone else whp cooks their prisoners meals and doesn't even lock them up!"

Massagin his temples, Kouji sighed and tried to control his temper.

"Well....what IS there to do around here?" He asked.

Beliamon opened her mouth to reply, but paused and placed a finger on her chin in thought.

"Uh...well...there's sleeping...and eating...and, um talking?" Beliamon ventured.

"Gee, I really want to spend my day getting fat and talking to an evil digimon." The blue haired boy sarcastically remarked.

"Uh, excuse you, but I am not an evil digimon. What gave you the idea that I was?" Beliamon questioned.

Kouji gave her a flat look.

"Kidnappped me, dresses in complete black, specializes in dark magic, need I say more?" Kouji counted off all of the reason on his fingers.

"For your information, digimon can't really help what they look like. This dress is a part of me. I was ORDERED to kidnap you, or one of your friends, you just got lucky, and Darkness and Evil are two seperate things. Most evil types just tend to specialize in darkness." Beliamon countered.


"Wait, you said that you just had to kidnap one of the group?" Kouji questioned.

Beliamon nodded. 'Well, close enough anyway.'


Kouji slumped and held his face in his hands.

"And it just HAD to be me. Why not Takuya? Or JP?" Kouji cried, calling out to the fates.

Beliamon giggled and winked at her prisoner.

"Because you just have good luck like that!" She remarked.

'And you were one of the most powerful children, as well as the one who needed my ckills the most. The other strong one, Takuya, he can fatten himself up easily if under the right circumstances.' Beliamon added as an afterthought.

Kouji glared at his captora moment or two, before getting up from the table and exiting the kitchen.

"Where are you going, my prescious?" Beliamon prodded the boy as he left.

"Somewhere to get away from you..." Kouji muttered, though Beliamon could tell that the bluenette was only a little bit miffed.

Beliamon sighed heavily and got up from the table as well.

"You could get lost. You don't know your way around!" Beliamon called to him.

"I'll manage." Was her reply, and Beliamon excused herself from the kitchen as well, muttering about Kouji and his attitude problems.

Before she left, however, she cast a quick glance towards various supplies, packed in simple boxes, that were around the room and gulped.

They were running low. Soon, Beliamon would have to visit the supply bunker, a keep of non-parishable supplies kept in an underground room after the...attack on Ayzahn Ra had begun.

Beliamon bit her lip as she hurried to catch up with Kouji.

That meant, soon, she would have to return to the city again...all of the destuction and death...and all her fault.
1341221121.title: Dinner and a sneaky Beliamon

13412211211.content:
Kouji settled down onto his straw bed. He tried to relax by stretching his back out and lacing his hands together behind his head. The gaze of his deep blue eyes ascended up towards the skylight carved into the cave ceiling. The atmosphere was a thick, dense, dark blue of late afternoon. Cloudy or not, it was still a time when the day began to cool off and shades stretched down over the streets; it was a time where Kouji found always found solace being by himself outside on a walk, or even napping underneath a tree.

The boy in blue sighed with relief as his body began to feel at ease. Kouji turned around in his bed, facing a smooth, brown tinged cave wall, wondering how extensive the tunnels ran through the Temple of Earth. When he had went off to find Beliamon, seemingly hours ago, he had noticed that the Temple encompassed much more area than he could have ever thought. Especially when returning from his dinner, Kouji really noticed how easy it was to get lost in the winding tunnels. He had almost gotten lost a few times while finding his way back, and Kouji had to take one or two more detours than he was comfortable with.

After roughly an hour of moving around in the tunnels, which Kouji observed were lined every now and again with torches, especially towards intersections, he had luckily managed to find an area which was familiar from his first venture, and from there, he remembered the way back. The dark blue haired boy hoped he would try to remember his way and make an effort not to get lost so easily again.

Kouji's stomach felt warm and almost full, as his appetite was still wanting more before it would be truly satisfied. For a scant minute, thoughts of the hot, creamy, buttery mashed potatoes and crispy chicken invaded his thoughts. Kouji bitterly knew that he perfectly well had it in him to finish off the entire dish, and the pickled memories that floated around in his mind about the half finished meal still in his grasp didn't help. He should have been able to put the food down well before that point.

Kouji crossed his arms and humphed at himself, blowing a stray lock of his hair up into the air with a heavy sigh....He really wasn't getting any thinner...

Just by looking down at himself, Kouji could see that while his weight hadn't noticably increased since he first entered the Temple, his weight hadn't decreased at all either. A bulge was beginning to protrude and become very apparent from under his yellow shirt. Even his arms were beginning to show a little pudge on them; although this was obscured by his jacket most of the time, he had decided to remove his jacket while resting, as it was still relatively warm in the cave. Now Kouji was beginning to regret that decision.

Shaking his head, Kouji tried to curl up and get a little sleep, or, at least, descend down in his thoughts for a little bit of deep brooding.

***

Taking an extra level of caution not to disturb her bandaged arm, Beliamon scrubbed away at a stray dish as vigorously as she could with a soapy sponge dowsed with hot water. After she had washed away all debris off the plate, she dried the plate, and then placed in on top of a few others she had finished... a small stack in comparison to the grim, towering, mountain of dirty dishes that dwarfed the minute progress she had already made.

Beliamon had already considered magicking the dishes to clean themselves, but with the current negative conditions, that possibility would take a lot out of her, maybe even considerably more than it would by just doing the chore by herself. She didn't want to take any chances, so Beliamon elected to do it as anyone else would. Still, it was a pain for her to do all by herself. She hadn't cleaned dishes in quite a while without magic... and still, back then, she was accustomed to working with others as a team to get the job done.

Dismissing her thoughts quickly before she could reminisce, Beliamon looked dismally towards the dishes she had left to do, and exhaled deeply.

"Well... what IS there to do?" a cloudy memory of Kouji asked her over, and over, and over again... Why, oh, why didn't she make him help her with the dishes?

Kouji was supposed to be her prisoner! The least she could do was ask him to do the dishes.

That thought occured to the golden haired digimon long since Kouji left, around the time when she had started her long, arduous chore; since the time the boy in blue had left, Beliamon had been having some deep thoughts about the coming days and the dwindling supplies. It was only when she realized the time and the dismal dishwashing job ahead of her, that she snapped out of it and began to work. Beliamon had then decided the perfect response if Kouji asked her what he was supposed to do as a prisoner again: she'd definitely make him do the dishes.

Soon, she began to imagine scenarios where she'd magick forth a mountain of extremely filthy dishes for poor Kouji to scrub away at while she laughed deviously with glee in the background at the sight.

Upon catching herself cackling a little at the thought, Beliamon paused. Would scrubbing dishes be too much excercise for him? Especially considering he didn't even finish his meals...

Well... maybe she'd help him a little with the dishes so that wouldn't happen.

As with most things, keeping a prisoner was, indeed, more challenging and difficult than intially imagined.

***

It was a bright, green, spring day. Birds sang the same song patterns as they did every year, and the blue skies were clear, albeit for a stray, white, puffy cloud here and there. The sun shone down on a soccer field, wet with dew.

A medium-sized class of young, white and blue uniformed students where out on the field, playing a game of soccer like small children would, that is, a good part of the game was spent giggling, tripping, and forgetting how to play the game. A slightly muscular gym teacher watched his entire class out on the field, ableit for one boy, who sat under a sturdy oak tree, stray from the rest of his class, reading a comic book and munching down on a chocolate bar every now and again.

"Are you sure you don't want to join your friends, Kouji?" the gym teacher called over to his first grade student, who responded by looking back at him from under the tree and nodding his little head before returning to his comic book.

That Kouji was a real puzzler, thought the gym teacher, he was a very slim boy and he seemed healthy enough... but why didn't he want to play out on the field? He'd made several attempts to get Kouji introduced to the class, but he seemed detached from the activity for some reason, much unlike the rest of the enthusiatic group, and simply uninterested in sports.

Oh well, shrugged the gym teacher, there've been kids just like him before, it's probably just a phase; give him a while, and he'll shake out of it, he'll be playing out on the fields in no time.

***

"Hey! I'm getting a message from Kouji!" Takuya cried, making everyone else's heads spin around to face his. In the immediate moment, the rest of the group began to move in towards the goggle head.

"Oooh! Whatsisay? Whatsitsay?" Neemon cried frantically while attempting to leap on Takuya.

"It says you'd better move over so I can see!" Bokomon snapped wisely, nudging his yellow companion aside.

Neemon's face took on a confused light, "Really?" he inquired, pushing Bokomon the other way from behind Takuya's back. Before long, the two Digimon had started to brawl behind Takuya while the others gathered around his digivice.

Takuya accepted the incoming message. Once it displayed on screen, he was a little suprised by the length, but he proceeded in reading it out loud, which everyone obliged to do in perfectly synchronized fashion.

Neemon blinked as he finished reading the message he had once held with indirect anticipation, "That sure was short."

"Well, it wasn't long," Bokomon responded, crossing his arms.

Zoe nodded, a concerned look on her face, "That's what I'm worried the most about. I'm glad Kouji got our messages and was able to send us a reply, but..." she faltered.

"Kouji really isn't... well, frank, when he writes," JP stated.

"Well, maybe he's really upset about something," Takuya boldly suggested, while Zoe returned him with a bleak look.

"Thanks, Takuya," Zoe mentioned sarcastically, "We already figured that much."

"Well, he certainly wouldn't just run off if he was perfectly happy with everything," JP said with slight, hopeful cheer.

"At least we know he's coming back in a few days," Tommy safely said, winning nods of approval from everyone else.

"Well, in that case, we'd better unpack and get ready for a few more days of camp," spoke Takuya, "So why don't we start on-"

"Don't say it," Zoe and JP popped up and warned in unison with unimpressed voices. Was food really the only thing Takuya could think about in a place like this?

***

The gym teacher sighed as she looked under the same old, elm tree as ever before. She had tried countless times, and still tried every day, to get Kouji involved in the game with other children since he had first moved to town at the beginning of the year, but even as whole months came and went, the boy was very adamant towards the situation.

Looking out towards the field, the teacher noted what Kouji was missing. As the children got older, their manner of play developed as well. Less time was spent being silly on the field, joking and giggling. Now, a majority of the time and students were being quite serious about the game; maybe too much because frequently they were bickering and arguing about the score, and who did what, and what counted as an accident and what didn't.

The gym teacher suspected that Kouji still hadn't made a single friend since he moved. Kouji seemed very introverted and collected, always spending most of his time in P.E. under the same tree, reading a comic book and eating either chips, candy bars, or some other incarnation of junk food.

If only Kouji would just make the move to start playing with the other children... She knew well enough that Kouji got teased and made fun of not just because he was a new kid, and not only because he was a quite chubby boy, but mainly because he declined to participate with the rest of the third graders. Maybe because of this, he seemed aloof to them, and this brought about the teasing.

Poor Kouji... she had to feel bad for him, even though he turned down all her advice to play. The gym teacher had been informed that Kouji moved a lot, almost more than once a year. She figured that at one point in his life, Kouji felt a little afraid to go play and make new friends because of the teasing and strange looks he recieved from being a new kid, and, after several moves, it just became a habit not to even try.

It was really taking a negative toll on his mind and body, the gym teacher noticed. She looked over to the elm tree and saw the tubby Kouji reading and eating some kind of chocolate caramel bar. He had a soft face and his round belly protruded and stuck outwards, making a visible bulge in his shirt. Even his little limbs seemed somewhat flabby. Eating all that candy isn't going to help, thought the gym teacher, but she noticed something else about Kouji, aside from his weight: his eyes.

Yes, Kouji may have gotten a little chubbier over the course of the third grade, but the biggest change she was noticing was also an effect of Kouji's lack of friends. At the beginning of the year, Kouji was generally happy, like most third graders, and the gym teacher actually expected that he would reach out and make friends like every other new student after the first few weeks. Although, as the year dragged on, Kouji began to lose more and more hope day by day as teasing got worse, and the gym teacher herself had to intervene at times.

Kouji never really was a problem, aside from the fact that he declined to play- some P.E. instructors would go nuts over that fact, and say that if he wasn't playing, she wasn't honestly doing her job, although she couldn't blame little Kouji after seeing some of the teasing and bullying he had to go through. Kouji was good-natured and quiet, and he never argued with the other students, even when they started teasing him. As the year went on, he started to put up a little resistance and stand up for himself.
