Kouji was beginning to get colder in personality, and the gym teacher hated to see that happen to him.

She really hoped Kouji would get out of his predicament. Each and every day she tried to convince the boy to play, but she had very little luck in doing so. She still had hopes for him, that he would make friends and finally fit in. She hoped that Kouji would never have to move ever again so that these friends would last him, however futile this hope was. Hopefully, this year, he would slim down like many boys did over the summer, and finally find the courage in him to enter the game and start anew. Maybe if he couldn't find a school or a home that would last the move, maybe he could find a love for a sport that would stay with him wherever he went and help him make friends.

She really hoped things would be alright for Kouji in the future...

***

It suddenly grew much colder in the cave, and Kouji huddled tightly in his bed, his jacket clutched closely to him.

Kouji had, indeed, begun to slim down that year when he hit a growth spurt. Luckily, he didn't gain any his puppy fat back. Suddenly, everything seemed so much easier to Kouji from there on in... well, at least for the physical fitness part. He was able to run and swim with times that were actually above average- not that he actively pursued those sports outside of school. Kouji still shyed away and found it very difficult to talk to others until he came to the digital world, where he was able to loosen up a little after sharing experiences and just being in the general vicinity of others trapped in a strange world just like him for quite a while.

He might have even said that aside from the perils, dangers, risks, and conflicts of saving the digital world from certain doom, he was actually doing pretty well with Takuya and the gang. Aside from the occasional moodiness, deep down, he actually felt content, and well, wanted.

He really had friends... although he'd never directly admit it to anyone right away.

Kouji sighed heavily once more as he looked down on himself, and maybe admitted to moaning a little with melancholy before descending into the soft bed of unconciousness.
13412211211.title: Memory and Dirty Dishes

choices: With Beliamon and Kouji, a few days later?
134122112112.content:
"Beliamon...she should have reported in by now..." Cherubimon muttered crossly as Mercurymon and the other Dark Warriors joined him in his chambers.

"Do you suspect she's not doing her job, my lord?" Mercurymon asked, soming to a halt in front of his master.

"No, the task I've set for Beliamon should have been enjoyable for her, so why she would not carry it out is questionable." Cherubimon contemplated.

"Then why don't ya'll just contact her yourself?" Ranamon suggested.

"I suppose I'll have to." Cherubimon concluded, and brought his hand out, letting the dark power gather until it was fixed on Beliamon's energy signature.

For a brief moment, Cherbimon felt a prick of familiarity at the signature, but the feeling was quickly lost as he called out for his servant.

"Beliamon, answer me. This is Cherubimon. What is your progress on the task?" He asked to the orb, but got no answer.

"...Beliamon? Beliamon! Answer me!" Cherubimon growled as he glared at the orb.

Finally, Beliamon's image appeared within the orb, looking quite frantic.

"You know, you really caught me at a bad time." she complained.

"Enough. Why have you not reported on your progress?" Cherubimon demanded.

"Uh..." Beliamon stumbled, "I've been quite busy. I've devised a plan that could yield wonderful results, but even a tiny error will shatter all the progress I've made so far."

"A plan? Please enlighten me. How has it affected the children to this point?" Cherubimon asked curously.

"Eh...child." Beliamon said quietly, clsoing her eyes in preparation for the outbust that was sure to follow.

"CHILD? You mean you've only been fattening ONE child?! When you could have been disabling ALL of them?!" Cherubimon roared.

"Please, my lord, allow me to explain. With the absence on one child, the group becomes frantic over the loss of that one. I however sent a message to them via Digivice impersonating my prisoner, the Warrior of Light, and telling them not to worry." Beliamon paused.

"Continue." Cherubimon gave premission for Beliamon to further explain.

"You see, in their current position, a grove of meat apples, they've fattened themselves up quite nicely. The message I sent them should stall them for a few more days. Once I finsih with the Warrior of Light, i can begina on another, but I'll need your help, or rather, the help of your Dark Warriors."

"And what should you need them do?" Cherubimon questioned.

"Have Arbormon and Grumble create and impassable barrier of stone and trees around the grove, ro even better, have them drain the data of the land surrounding it. Whatever you have them do, it is imperative that they not leave that grove. If they did, my plan would fall to peices and they'd have contact with Ophanimon again. To keep this from happening, have Mercurymon and Ranamon spy on them, but under no circumstances engage them in battle." Beliamon finished.

For a moment, Cherubimon ran Beliamon's plan through his head.

It was sound, had no visible flaws, and if everything went according, should yield better resluts than those orignally hoped for.

"Very well. But Beliamon- do not try my patience like this in the future again. Failing to report in again in the future may just reslut in your destruction." Cherubimon warned.

"Yes, my lord, I understand."

"By the way, exactly WHERE are you. Your energy siganture is coming from a void in the Digital World."

Biamon's face twitched a moment and she wass silent.

"A small island with a cave that was missed when the region's data was drained." she said monoutanously.

It wasn' a lie, but it wasn't true either.

"Ah, strange that it was missed, but I suppose it can happen. You very well can't hold a prisoner in the middle of an empty space." Cherubimon reasoned.

"Yes, my lord." Beliamon agreed.

"And now to matters of the warrior of light. How has his progress been?" CHerubimon asked.

"Subject was taken in already a few pounds overweight. Since then, his weight has not decreased, but only increased a tiny amount. Subject is very...touchy about his increasing girt, and at first has shown little interest in food, and has even made attempts to exercise. However, more recentyl, subject has shown a greater apetite, if only a little, and appears to be subissive to his fate. Subject has also begun to show small signs of trust to myself." Beliamon droned on.

"Ah, it appears that you have been doing a good job after all Beliamon. It surprises me he would actually trust his captor. I cannot wait until he sees that you've been working for me the whole time. The utter betrayal of it all!" Cherubimon shouted and laughed loudly.

Beliamon's neutral face shifted for a moment, and her eyes shined a bit, but she quickly put on her stony expression again.

"Yes...he is a fool." Beliamon muttered.

Cherubimon nodded.

"Very well, then. I've heard all that I've need to know for now, but remember to keep me informed in the future." Cherubimon ordered.

Beliamon nodded, and her image disappeared within the orb of black power and CHerubimon then let the darkness in his palm disssipate.

He then stared down at his Dark Warriors expectantly.

They stared back.

Cherubimon gwoled in annoyance.

"Don't you have jobs you should be doing? If I recall, you have some data darining and espionage to do!" Cherubimon barked.

Mercurymon, Ranamon, Grumblemon, and Arbormon all mumbled a "Yes, my lord." and were off, leaving Duskmon alone with his master.

...I was not assigned a task..." the warrior of Darkness mumbled, almost sounding dejected.

"Its just as well Duskmon, for you see, I have a mission for you myself. Call it...insurance. As the Warrior of Darkness, you are quite skilled in espionage yourself and I want you to keep an eye on Beliamon....she seems odd." Cherubimon ordered.

"Yes, my lord." Duskmon said and bowed, vanishing in the shadows.

"Beliamon..." CHerubimon though aloud, now alone in his chambers, "For your sake, you had better not betrayed me."
134122112112.title: Reporting In

choices: Beliamon and Kouji continue their trip down the tunnels.
1341221121121.content:
Kouji had uttered a deep and languished sigh when he first opened his dark blue eyes that morning. He didn't seem to find himself surrounded not by the clean, white walls of his bedroom, nor looking up to clear skies with a campfire from the night before long since extinguished.

No, he was still enclosed by the same, old, rock walls of the cave... Sitting up on his straw bed against the earthen wall, wrapping his arms around his legs, Kouji collected that it really was a wistful feeling one gets when waking up after sleeping away from one's home...

Why did he, even in a twilight half-concious state, honestly assume he was away in the security of his room or resting under the stars with his friends when both of those couldn't be any farther away from him?

And then, all in an instant, his eyes snapped opened, reality returned, and it all vanished.

Oh...

Moments soon settled and distilled into slow, quiet, unmeasurable minutes as Kouji remained seated in the same position. The scarce, pale sunlight from the above skylight beamed down faintly on the boy clad in blue, his eyes glinting as he looked up, and-

"Oh, I didn't know you were up," remarked a now familiar voice. Kouji spun his head around quickly to see the golden haired Beliamon leaning a pale arm against a smooth surface near the cave entry.

Crossing his arms, the dark haired boy merely looked at her, nodded curtly, adknowledging her presence, and tried to remained silent as long as he could before mumbling softly, "...What do you want now?"

His captor's face twitched for less than a moment before she muttered sarcastically in return, "Well, it's nice to see your smiling face this morning, too, Kouji," as she entered the cavern, slightly shaking her head at the ponytailed boy's warm greeting.

"Well, I fixed you some breakfast," Beliamon stated as took a tray with a plate stacked full of steaming, golden pancakes, napkin roll of utensils, and crispy bacon and a small pitcher of maple syrup and placed the two in front of Kouji's straw bed, "And I strongly suggest you actually eat up this time- you might actually need the energy today," Beliamon recommended as she leaned back onto the cave wall opposite him.

Kouji huffed and peered up at Beliamon, tenatively making a grab for the napkin roll in front of him before freezing, "Hold on... what's so special about today?"

"Well..." Beliamon started, letting the word hang in the air for a while, rolling her eyes, "You might say we're going on a little excursion."

"Oh..." Kouji sighed blandly, pretending not to be interested in the least, much contrary to his true thoughts of question and anticipation. Where did she plan on taking him? Out of the caves? To another location? Why? Because his friends had almost found their location?

He now shrugged, undid the roll, poured some syrup on the pancakes, took out his knife and fork out, and put the first, fluffy, sweet mouthful of pancake into his mouth. He closed his eyes, if only for a moment, they were so good. But, again, quickly, as he snapped open his eyes, reality came back to him, and letting Beliamon know he was actually enjoying her cooking was the last thing he wanted to do.

"Yes, so, as soon as you're finished, I think it will be a good time to set off, that is, given I go and gather a few things," said Beliamon, to which Kouji only nodded in mild approval as he stuffed half of a syrup-smothered pancake into his mouth. Beliamon smiled slightly at the dark haired boy, although she was hoping that her little smirk wouldn't cause him to grow suspicious and lose his appetite altogether.

Suddenly, the two of them could have sworn they heard a moderately loud, crisp, cracking noise in the far crevices of the cave, echoing and reverberating all the way up the passage to their ears before it faded softly and altogether into the darkness.

Beliamon grew silent and paled a little, and luckily for her, Kouji didn't notice her expression because he was too busy worrying about her noticing him enjoying breakfast.

"What wath that?" Kouji mumbled with his mouth full, blushing a little when he noticed his muffled voice.

"I'm not sure... hopefully it wasn't a cave in," Beliamon sighed, but she knew well that the elder mages had long since cast reenforcement spells and enchantments on the rock walls of the Temple of Earth so that it would stand strong throughout the ages, so that no such transient thing would happen to it, among all other stone constructs.

"Maybe it was a mouse or a bat or something," Kouji shrugged, now staring down at a trail of syrup and a what once was a tower of pancakes. All that was left was some strips of bacon, which he helped himself to without much question.

Within not even a minute, the bacon had been polished off, and Kouji placed the plate on the stone ground without so much as a clatter, "Done," he stated, getting up and stretching his arms out fully. He felt his small paunch peek out from under his yellow shirt and jiggle slightly as a result of this, but he quickly tucked it away before anyone could notice.

"Alright, then," Beliamon said after carefully giving a quick look down the surrounding hallways, "Shall we start?" she asked with a tilt of her head, indicating a nearby tunnel to the left hand side.

With a nod of his head, Kouji obliged to follow Beliamon's lead as they proceeded to walk the passages strange and unknown to him, awaiting what destination she may lead him to...
1341221121121.title: A Little Excursion

choices: Towards the Eastern Sector of the city?
13412211211211.content:
Beliamon and Kouji had been walking for quite a while now, they had departed soon after Beliamon had gathered some supplies, now in a backpack over her shoulders, through the cavernous tunnels that made up the Temple of Earth. They had walked so far into the temple, Kouji noticed, that the torches Beliamon had put up on the paths they normally used, like the one to the kitchen, had disappeared and Beliamon had resorted to using a ball of flame balanced in her palm for light.

Kouji ran a hand through his hair, realizing it was mildly wet with sweat. Kouji wondered why Beliamon would take him on such a trip with the exercise he was getting, but decided not to speak up lest she conjure a flying carpet or something for him to ride on. At least like this, he might burn a pound or two off.

"Here have some jerky. Keep your energy up." Beliamon suddenly said, handing back a few pieces of the dried meat to him.

After she'd turned back around, Kouji stared blankly at her back, eye twitching.

OR she could just stuff him on the way there...

"So...where are we going anyway?" Kouji asked as he tore into one of the pieces of jerky.

"We need supplies. Eventually one of these passages should take us out of the Temple and into what's left of the city outside. We'll stop there for lunch then head back with the supplies and make it back just in time for Dinner." Beliamon stated, rounding a sharp turn.

"Wait...I thought you said the only ways out of this place was either the main entrance or that one skylight?" Kouji asked suspiciously.

"Ah, I did say that didn't I? Well it just so happens I myslef had forgotten about this particualr exit until this morning."

"Then how can you be so sure I won't use it to escape?" Kouji suggested.

Beliamon chuckled.

"Please, Kouji. I don't think you can remember all the twists and turns to get to this exit without getting lost, and even if you could, you havn't been paying attention to the paths we've taken so far. And besides, if you did escape through these tunnels to leave the temple, we're still on an island with no ticket off for you other than myself." Beliamonexplained with a smirk.

"Hmph. So I guess I really am stuck here until my friends get the picture and come and rescue me, huh? I don't suppose you plan on releasing me soon." Kouji muttered.

"I..." Beliamon trailed off. "I don't know."

"You don't know? What do you mean 'I don't know.'?" Kouji asked.

"I mean I don't know exactly when I'll be able to relase you." Beliamon said almost neutrally, but that was a hint of sadness in her voice.

Unfortunately, Kouji didn't catch it.

"What? You can relase me at any time you want to! I don't understand you at all! You capture me, but sometimes you act like a...a babysitter more than a warden!" Kouji spat hotly.

Beliamon turned and gave him a hard stare.

"What makes you think I'm doing this by my free will? Did you ever consider I might have been forced?" Beliamon asked, keeping her anger in check and staring holes into Kouji.

"Pah. You? The way you talk about yourself? You yuself said you could hold your own with some Digimon above Champion level." Kouji retorted.

"No matter how powerful you think you are, there is ALWAYS someone more powerful than you." Beliamon stated, and the way she said it made Kouji feel as if she was talking from past experience.

Then Beliamon turned around and briskly resumed her pace, and not wanting to be left in the dark tunnels, Kouji followed, but both stayed silent.

'Beliamon...what is she? She's evil, or at least I think she is....she captured me! Of course she's evil...though she seems almost too...hyperactive sometimes to be evil...ugh.' Kouji thought furiously as he continued to follow Beliamon, his mind at war with itself.

Beliamon, ahead of him, was also quite out of order, but for entirely different reasons.

'I know you're here. If you tink I'm so stupid as to not feel you, lurking in the shadows, right behind us, then you're insane. I felt you when you first teleported in...Duskmon. But...for some reason you feel different from the others...' Beliamon though, knowing very well that the Warrior of Darkness had intruded upon the Temple of Earth.

This was going to make things a lot harder on her. She obviously had to step up on puttting the pounds on Kouji, and she couldn't be as casual unless she found a way to get Duskmon out of her temple soon. She was foolish to forget Duskmon when reporting into CHerubimonlast night. Of course, the bastard would send his little corrupt warripr to spy on her.

Beliamon then subconsciously glanced back behind her, seeing know Duskmon, but she knew he was there. She could feel it. Hopefully, he wouldn't stray from the Temple of Earth into Ayzahn Ra once they got there....at least until sunset.

Then Beliamon glanced down at Kouji, his face set on the ground and his brow knit in deep thought as he followed her.

He really was getting too much exercise.

'I'll just have to macke sure he eats all of his dinner I suppose...' Beliamon thought idly as she turned back around.

At the rate Kouji was eating now, Beliamon would almost bet money that those other kids she'd left behind we're fattening up more, although she did notice that Kouji was increasing in size albeit very slowly and almost unnoticeable. However, Beliamon's sharp eye didn't miss how his little paunch could be noticed now even while wearing clothes and how Kouji had taken to adjucting his pants every now and then, taking this as an indicationt that they were just a little too tight for comfort.

'In any case, something has to be done, ow we're BOTH screwed...' Beliamon thought sulkily, putting a hand to her forehead.

"Um...Beliamon? Is that the exit, over there?" Kouji then asked, snapping her out of her thoughts.

Beliamon then noticed she had missed the correct turn off an had been about to lead herself and Kouji into a labryinth of tunnels even she didn't know.

"Oh! Yes, that's it. I had my mind on other things, sorry about that." Beliamon apologized and walked over to the tunnel exit and looking out, Kouji following her.

"Behold, Kouji, the cty of Ayzahn Ra...or what's left anyway."

Kouji stepped up to look out through the portal of stone and his jaw dropped at the sight.

Ayzahn Ra was a maginificent city. The buildings were made out of a deep gray stone and the roofs looked to be almost Italian from the way Zoe had described them before and ranged from deep red to yellow, orange, cerulean and emerald, and sparkled amost like gems in the sunlight. Yet almost all of the buildings were ruined or partially collapsed.

What held Kouji's attention the longest though was a tower at what must have been the cneter of the city. it was fashioned from the same gray stone, yet the roof was gone, and exposed was a shinign golden bell.

"Wehn Cherubimon attacked, that tower was really the only thing that survived. In fact, the bell still rings sometimes." Beliamon said, referring to the belltower and staring at it herself.

"Cherubimon...destroyed this city?' Kouji asked, both bewildered and angry.

"Yes. And all of its inhabitants...except for one, to which he dealt a fate worse than deletion." Beliamon stated, proceeding to walk down a path towards the remains of the city. "But enough of that. Hurry up, we don't have much time."

Kouji nodded absentmindedly, still in awe of Ayzahn Ra and he and Beliamon then descended into the dead city, more specifically, towards the....
13412211211211.title: Through the Tunnels

choices: The two finally made entry into the city.
134122112112111.content:
The two proceeded down to the faded city. Colorless rubble lay where once solid, gigantic stone walls cast with runes acted as a gateway to the entrance to the Temple, which was now a gaping hole, which the two calmly paced out of.

Now, Beliamon and Kouji walked down a gray hill that descended to the streets of the city. Strangely, the hill still had some covering of grass, even though the entire area silently screamed of lifelessness. Strangely, the grass seemed to be devoid of color, and it was mostly gray, maybe with a spot of drab, dull hazel here or there. Even the dirt was a grayish-brown, and the dusty, rocky material covered the hill where the grass did not.

Kouji thought he saw Beliamon shudder, but it probably was only a flinch. He certainly had shivers running down his spine, even though he had never been to the place before, and the city didn't really have a place in his heart, although he tried to conceal these strange sentiments from anyone else, namely, Beliamon.

Old, bare, dried out trees dotted parts of the hills, standing dark and silent like shriveled-up, gnarled hands out of the soil. Trees might have grown where they were walking...

Kouji turned his attention back to the belltower, standing tall among most of the other buildings, but as they descended, it grew taller and taller as they got closer to the streets. He guessed that was where they were heading first.

The air hung thin and dry in the slight distance of the city, and swallowed up everyone's words in its mysterious sorrow.

Beliamon seemed strangely quiet. After her introduction of the city to Kouji, she proceeded to walk forward at a steady, almost dreamlike pace. After exiting the tunnels, not once did she try to slip him a strip of jerky or any other food, a startling notion indeed. Since then, not once did she turn back to make sure that he was following her, although, Kouji had to admit that the two of them were blatantly out in the open now, not in a labyrinth of dark, twisting tunnels where it was easy to get lost forever in, and he would have to run at least a mile away or into the city before he could be out of Beliamon's plain view.

Nonetheless, he kept on walking and following her. Kouji felt a bead of sweat drip down onto his nose, which he wiped away. He could feel his pulse beating more. His slight weight was starting to catch up with him. The mildly pudgy boy in blue exhaled deeply and took a breath, hoping he wouldn't run out of breath in a bit.

Soon, he began to wonder why he would think that he'd run out of breath because Beliamon's pace soon slowed to stopping. She just looked folornly up at the partially ruined belltower and toward a few other, crumbling buildings, and sighed.

"We'll stop for a break before we enter the city," Beliamon told Kouji quietly, her voice crisp and bereft of happiness. Her eyes were partially obscured by a shadow as she tilted down her head. Kouji nodded silently and plopped his behind down on the hard, dusty ground with an, "Oof..."

Slowly, Beliamon lowered her own body to the ground and sufficed to sit down with her feet flat and knees pointed up, over which, she crossed her arms. Her eyes gazed down toward where the city lay in ruin. Kouji wondered whether she saw the city or saw nothing at all...

Suddenly, Kouji gasped when he looked beyond to one side of the hills; one side of it had dissappeared totally, a whole side of it raw craggy rocks and dirt, with hard, gnarled roots hanging out, grasping into nothingness. It formed a kind of canyon of sorts, two, tall, imposing rocky cliffs, except with no bottom. If one were to fall in there, they'd never land, and just keep on falling... into the dark gray abyss...

It was then when he noticed that the darkish, grey hue of the skies wasn't because of clouds, but because that the 'sky' was an absense of presence. The 'sky' was made of nothing.

It wasn't as if the sky was darkness or anything, where one could not see, but it was as if Kouji was staring beyond it, straining to see reality, but it was too far away to see. It was a hard concept for even Kouji to describe, and he had to look away within a few minutes as his eyes began to hurt from the strain.

It was an ocean of emptiness.

The two of them sat there quietly, now both were gazing down at the city. Kouji could see that the city must have once been a spectacular place, full of people, or Digimon, should he say, and the thought that they were all deleted, save one, chilled him.

As he had a closer view of the city, he could now see that there was one area toward the outskirts that had been partially deleted, with one building standing cleanly cut in half. He could see the floors in it and the different rooms, however aside from that, he was still far away and couldn't see the furniture and what might lay inside, and thus he wasn't able to tell one from another.

Beliamon had told him that Ayzahn Ra was a village of Mage Digimon, and that ten temples had been built around the city after the Ten Legendary Warriors. Of course, they were residing in the Temple of Earth... now, turning back, Kouji noted the ornate entry way and carved stone sign and torch holders that marked the way to the Temple. Kouji didn't see anything like it in the surrounding area, and if anything, just areas of hill, some whole to a point, others deleted severely, the ocean of emptiness almost reaching the city itself.

Kouji thought he saw a glimmer of water in the distance and perhaps it was a winding river leading into a somewhat small pool, which was partially obscured by a rock wall hanging over it, and he wondered if that was part of the remains of the Temple of Water.

Kouji shuddered as another chill took his body. It wasn't brought about by wind or the cold... it was just the strange, eerie feeling he got being in the area. Maybe it was the emptiness and lack of life. Whereas even those dimly-lit tunnels of the Temple of Earth were quiet, they were still full of life and they were still part of the earth. This place, however, seemed to be... thrown off of the natural balance somehow.

He turned to look at Beliamon, who was still staring down at the city, with a stolid, unwavering look on her face, as if nothing at all in the world would bother her in the least. It was just then, while looking at Beliamon, Kouji noticed something startling...

"Your bandage; it's gone," Kouji cried as quietly as he could, "And your arm, it's-"

"Healed, I know," Beliamon smiled curtly, now turning her gaze to the boy in blue, "I guess Digimon recover faster than the average human, but, still, we do need patching up when injured. We're not invincible, you know..." Beliamon's voice and eyes trailed off to the city, before her eyes turned down, she closed them and sighed.

"We really should get a move on, then," Beliamon said, "We've been staying out here on the hills for too long, and we're so close to the city, too," she stated, getting up and dusting her dark dress off.

Kouji groaned and got himself up off of the ground too, dusting his pants off along the way.

"You know what they say, so little time, so much to do," Beliamon said as she continued to walk down the hill, "Come on, Kouji," she waved as she motioned to the belltower.
134122112112111.title: On the Outskirts of the Ruined City...

1341221121121111.content:
Kouji's and Beliamon's footsteps echoed as they made their way through what Kouji supposed was a main entry to the ruined city.

The atmosphere, quiet and surreal, coupled with the repatative sounds of footsteps, caused a very eerie feeling to wash over Kouji indeed.

It was almost like they were trespassing on forbidden grounds. As if, Ayzahn Ra itself, or what was left of it, glared down upon them as they continued their trek to the belltower, and telling them to return the way they had come.

And even stranger was how Beliamon was acting, quiet, stoic, and serious. Not the bouncy, sarcastic captor he had come to know, the city seemed to have taken her over.

The whole city oozed nothingness, as empty and devoid as the abyss that bordered it.

"So...we're going to the belltower?" Jouji questioned, observing the stones that made of the street, noting how varied they were in size and how ornate they were.

"Yes. After the initial attack on the city, the digimon that were left used the belltower as a fort to fight against Cherubimon." Beliamon said and sighed. "Though he wiped them out easily and efficiently. Yet even after he attacked them, their refuge still stood. There's still a good deal of supplies there as well, all magically enchanted to never spoil or attract disease."

"These mages...they must have been extremely powerful to create such spells and build such a city..." Kouji mused, eying what was left of a shop appearing to have sold magic texts.

"Yes...though they may have well have been fleas compared to Cherubimon." Beliamon muttered bitterly. "Ayzahn Ra was a city influenced by its environments. Many digimon lived him and the influence of the Temples made it a vibrant and beautiful city...but now, you see those things are gone. All that is left is the Temple of Earth and the abyss. As such, Ayzahn Ra is only a shadow of its formr magnificense. In fact, if it wasn't for the Temple of Earth, what's left of the city now would probably have been destroyed as well."

"Wait...you seem to know a lot about this city.." Kouji muttered suspiciously.

"I...travelled through it several times, learning magics." Beliamon quickly covered.

"Oh..." Kouji mumbled, shoulders drooping in disappointment. "But Cherubimon...he really destroyed this city? And he deleted all of the digimon?"

"...yes. He was ruthless. The city went from prospering in the morning to like it is now at night." Beliamon said, looking up at the belltower, it ringing out as she did so.

Kouji's eyes narrowed and he clenched his fists in fury.

"I can't believe him! How could he be so heartless, so cruel as to do this?! I swear that I'll destroy him and avenge everyone who was deleted!" Kouji shouted, his voice reverbrating throughtout the city.

Beliamon chuckled darkly.

"Don't be stupid. Cherubimon is a Mega level digimon and he has the power of five Legendary Warriors. What makes you think you and your ragtag griup of friends can avange Ayzahn Ra? OR save the Digital World for that matter? THat same kind of thinking got Ayzahn Ra destroyed originally." Beliamon spat.

"Well...there has to be some way...we can't just let the Digital World be destroyed..." Kouji muttered, frustrated.

Beliamon glanced back at him a moment, as if thinking, but then shook her head.

"Listen...if I were you, once I'm able to relase you, I'd just find my friends and look for a way home. Even if you could defeat CHerubimon-IF; then you'd have to defeat Lucemon as well and that's just impossible." Beliamon warned.

"...Lucemon?" Kouji asked, confused. "I've never heard of him before...you mean Cherubimon actually WORKS for someone?!"

Beliamon sighed and prepared to tell the tale.

"Yes he does. Why do you think he's collecting data? Many many years ago, there was a war between the digimon of the Digital World. It went on for ages with no signs of letting up until a powerful Angel digimon arose to quell the fighting. That was Lucemon."

Kouji nodded for her to continue.

"After that, things were okay for a while, but Lucemon became corrput. He became a tyrant and began to destroy the Digitla World. It was then the Ten Legendary Warriors stepped in and, in a grand battle that took their lives, defeated Lucemon. But even they couldn't fully defeat him, so instead they sent him to the center of the Digital World, where he continues to sleep to this day. And then, Lucemon hadn't even been at full power. After that, the power of the Legendary Warriors, the Spirits you use, was divided among three powerful Angel digimon. Five were divided among Seraphimon and Ophanimon, and the other five were trusted to Cherubimon. After he fell to the dark side, however, he corrupted the Spirits he held and the Dark Warriors were created. He then captured Ophanimon and Seraphimon, whose Spirits were then scattered across the lands, until found by you." Beliamon told darkly.

"That's...I can't believe this...so much we didn't know..." Kouji muttered, awed.

Beliamon chuckled.

"Shocking, no? Well, you would have learned it sooner or later. Now do you see the utter hopelessness of facing Cherubimon? Not only is he a powerful digimon in his own right, but he has Lucemon backing him up. Not to mention the Dark Warriors." Beliamon said.

Kouji's eyes were glued to the pavement as he walked, but the fires of determination still burned in his eyes, Beliamon noted.

Sighing, Beliamon stopped her pace as she and Kouji arrived at their destination.

"But who am I to tell you what to do. I really don't have that much experience with humans. If you're able to destroy the Dark Warriors before Cherubimon revives Lucemon, you might just have a chance." Beliamon somewhat encouraged, walking over towards the Belltower's entrance. "Now, come on. Help me find where those old wizards stashed the food."

Kouji nodded, noticing Beliamon act a bit like her normal self, and walked over to the entrance.

'I wonder what everyone else is doing right now...' Kouji absently thought and sighed. 'I bet Takuya's lost weight by now...boy am I gonna get it when they finally DO rescue me...'

Kouji and Beliamon then descended into the only building still functioning within the ruined city of Ayzahn Ra.
1341221121121111.title: Within the Dead City

choices: Back at Ayzahn Ra with Beliamon and Kouji.
At the camp with the others.
13412211211211112.content:
Takuya exhaled deeply, as he lay back and snuggled into a comfortable position on a seemingly sturdy tree branch. Idly waving his arm through the air, he managed to snag an already cooked meat apple from the backpack he had hanging on another, nearby branch.

"This is the life..." he muttered contently, closing his eyes, taking a big bite out of the ivory colored meat apple he clutched in his hand. Somewhat sweet and salty tastes flooded his mouth as he chewed down on the tasty morsel, "Mmm... ham."

The setting was absolutely wonderful. It was a nice, sunny day, as it always was in the meat apple grove- another advantage it had over a few other areas in the Digital World. There were clear skies, with an exception for the puffy white clouds that hovered above them all. Takuya found himself looking up at the cottonesque formations in the skies more often than ever before now, trying to get others to guess what shapes they resembled.

Takuya had also found his little niche in the area, branch, to be more precise. He had climbed this very meat apple tree he was currently resting in when he had first come to the meat apple grove looking for something to do while dinner cooked. It was then when he discovered it: the perfect resting place.

It was just the ideal, and strangely, most comfortable branch imaginable. Takuya could be warmed by the sun and still be shaded by the leaves without getting too hot or cool. It seemed to be pretty thick and sturdy, but the way Takuya liked to stretch his body out on it caused him to lay over some of the thinner areas of the branch.

"Mmm..." went Takuya as he continued to devour the meat apple. It tasted just as good, if not, even better than the first meat apple he had even eaten. It was strange because it had been all he had been eating for days, weeks even, and yet he still didn't get bored of it...

'Of course!' thought Takuya, 'It's probably because meat apples change flavors all the time. You never know what you'll get... it will be ham one day, the next-'

His thoughts were interrupted by a familar voice calling his name. Groaning, opening his eyes, and turning his head down to earth, from his paradise high in the air, he could see a miffed looking blonde haired girl tapping her foot, "What is it now, Zoe?"

"I can't believe you, Takuya. You're lazing about again?" the blue eyed girl asked with a raised voice, looking up to face the carefree boy resting in the tree.

"Huh?" he blinked, shifting from his current position and pushing himself forward so he could turn around to face her. "Is there anything wrong with that?"

"Well..." Zoe started, but soon lost momentum as her voice trailed off and her eyes looked to the side, "I guess-"

Suddenly, her scolding words were interrupted as a loud, dry, snapping noise cracked in the air.

"Uh-oh," Takuya squeaked nervously. Instantly, the branch Takuya was resting on was now starting to tilt rapidly towards the ground as it broke off and fell about six or seven feet to the ground, Takuya plunging after it.

The sound of the fall, if any, was mostly muffled by the springy, green grass, and that's not to say that Takuya's abrupt drop wasn't cushioned at all because of his rearend. In fact, all there were only two sounds that resulted from the fall, and the first was Takuya groaning an, "Oof..." as the pale faced, somewhat suprised boy dusted himself up and got up, now bereft of his perfect resting spot and feeling quite mournful in a way.

The next reaction was, of course, the hysterical laughter coming from the girl in the pink and purple ensemble. She threw her face up with chuckles and continued to giggle until she was a little red in the face.

"I don't see what's so funny," Takuya grumbled, putting his hands on his waist.

"That's it!" Zoe cried, throwing her hands in the air, thus concluding her laughter.

"Uhm, sorry, I still don't know. What's it?" the thick-headed boy asked, tapping his head with his knuckles a few times.

Zoe sighed, tilting her head down before rising back up to answer him, "Well, eating meat apples all day long that you smuggled to your tree can't be good for you, and... well, if now you're heavy enough to break the branch you've always rested on since we first came here... it says something, you know?" she stated, tilting an index finger to the side.

"Oh..." Takuya lamented softly, now looking down at the snapped off branch laying across the grass wet with dew. Suddenly, Takuya blinked and snapped out of it as he understood something.

"Hey!" he cried, "Are you saying I'm getting fat?"

"Well, sneaking the amount you do every day isn't going to make you any smaller," Zoe remarked, smirking. Takuya started to blush as he looked down at himself.

She was right...

In the handful of days since Kouji left (probably to work off the extra poundage), Takuya was sure that he had done absolutely nothing in the way of excercising to get back in shape after the uncomfortable ordeal he had with Kouji right before he left.

In fact, Takuya had probably GAINED weight since then! He had a definite potbelly now, bulging against his yellow shirt, and even though it wasn't huge, it was still apparent, and you could still tell he was getting out of shape from just a glance. It also probably wasn't a good sign that his butt had probably entirely cushioned the fall from the tree...

"Well, you're no better!" Takuya accused as he pointed a finger at Zoe.

"Me?" she cried, her face flushing into a shade of red as she nervously ran her fingers through a lock of golden blonde hair.

"Yeah, you said you snuck meat apples too, didn't ya?" said Takuya.

"Well, yes, but not as much as you..." Zoe smirked weakly.

"Oh reeeally?" Takuya asked, giving her an evil smile, batting his brown eyes back and forth towards her body, which was beginning to get quite chubby.

He was right.

Zoe started to sweat nervously. She looked down and surveyed the damage that snacking had done to her... now, even the weight was showing up on her stomach, and it really was starting to stick out: something that she was lucky enough not to gain the first couple of days at the meat apple grove... But now it was starting to jiggle slightly when she was ran or was walking and stopped abruptly. And still, that wasn't all...

In an instant, she took a step forward, swung her hand toward Takuya's face and promptly smacked him.

"Ow!" he cried as his face glowed red in the affected area, "What was that for?"

"What? You must have been looking at me all the time to notice such a slight difference..." she growled as she spun her head back at him.

"No, I-" Takuya started, poking two fingers together.

"Ohh... never mind," Zoe said, calming down, "Oy, this is so much like deja vu to just a few days ago with you and Kouji it's not even funny."

"Kouji," Takuya said, resting his head down and wondering where he is, "I bet he's so skinny right now, running through the woods on hikes and what not. Maybe he'll come back a little more muscular too."

"Perhaps, it wouldn't hurt us to take a hike in the woods ourselves," Zoe suggested, placing a hand below her slight gut and bouncing it up and down for a moment.

"Yeah, but we said that we would wait a few days here for him to come back," Takuya reminded Zoe.

"Hmm, well, we could always meet him in the woods, right? I mean, we could always send him a message with our digivices to let him know where in the woods we were, maybe signal a landmark or something," Zoe said.

"I don't know, Zo. I'm in favor of playing it safe for a few more days," Takuya said, "Honestly, I think he's bound to be back tonight or maybe tomorrow night."

"If you say so, Takuya," Zoe smiled as she nodded, indicated for him to follow, and the two went off to the others.
13412211211211112.title: Weighty Crisis in the Grove

choices: With Beliamon and Kouji back in Ayzahn Ra?
134122112112111122.content:
JP and Tommy turned to look at Takuya and Zoe as they entered the campsite, their loud footsteps signaling theirt arrival.

"Took you long enough to find him, Zoe." JP remarked as the blonded in question positioned herself on a log next to a fire, in which a large kettle of meat apples were simmering, practically done.

"Can we eat now...?" Tommy whined, licking his lips as he gazed intently on a meat apple bobbing in the pot over the fire.

"Well, its not my fault Pudgey over there fell out of his tree and caused me to go into hysterics!" Zoe spat, pointing an accusing finger at takuya, who had immediately joined Tommy near the meat apples.

"Hey!" Takuya exclaimed, for a moment focusing his attention on Zoe rather than filling his stomach. "Its not MY fault that the branch decided to break!"

Zoe cackled.

"Well that tree didn't get shorter or thinner! You've sat on it ever since we've got here, munching on meat apples and sleeping! And since it didn't get thinner then you've had to have gotten thicker!" Zoe shouted, frustrated.

Takuya crossed his arms and turned away.

"I havn't gained THAT much weight..." Takuya defended, but all the same putting his hands on his stomach and looking down at how sperical his belly had become, barely able to see his feet from under the mound of flesh.

Long gone were the few muscles gained from playing soccer. In place of them now was a month a three quarters worth of meat apples. Any slight upward movement of his arms would lift his shirt up, revealing the Buddha belly and his pants; they were so uncomfortable now, he'd almost taken to wearing them around unbuttoned. They were sure hard enough to get back up after using the bathroom.

"Takuya," Zoes said matter-of-factly, "I can see belly pushing against your shirt from here! You certainly havn't gained muscle! And soon you'll even have boobs! if you havn't got them already, that is. At thte rate you're going, no, the rate we're ALL going, we'll outgrow our clothes in the next few days!"

"Well...okay, so I'm a little chubby. It'll melt right off when Kouji comes back!" Takuya said, dismissing the subject. "Now let's eat; I', starved!"

Both Zoe and JP sighed and shook their heads. If Kouji wasn't back soon Takuya would probably grow to sumo wrestler proportions.

"Do you even care that you're getting fat..?" Zoe asked weakly as Takuya took a hearty bite from his first meat apple, but certainly not his last.

"Hmm...maybe?" Takuya responded with a clueless look on his face.

"Well, I'M going on a diet! No more meat apples for me!" Zoe resolved.

"Yeah, I should probably hold off on them too..." JP agreed.

Takuya shrugged and simply tore into another meat apple.

"Oh well. More for me!" Takuya shouted gleefully.

"Yay!" Tommy sconding the opinion.

JP and Zoe then endured several long minutes of Takuya and Tommy devouring the juicy, delectible meat apples without remorse.

Both licked their lips subconsiously.

"Oh, to hell with it..." Zoe cursed, walked over to the meat apples and dug in herself, JP following suit.

In their feasting, they were unaware of they two cerulean orbs observing from the shadows.

"Beliamon was sure right...let them continue at this pace, and they'll be as bif as hogmon!" Ranamon exclaimed quietly through the communication device connected to both Cherubimon and Mercurymon.

"Ah..so she was not lying. This is good. Mercurymon, how goes things on your end?" Cherubimon asked from his castle.

"Things are proceeding according to plan, my lord." Mercurymon responded as he surveyed Grumblemon and Arbormon drain the dat of the land surrouding the area the children were in. "Its coming slowly but surely."

"Good. Soon the children will be trapped. Then they can gorge themselves to immobility. Then we strike!" CHerubimon exclaimed and cackled, his laugh resounding throught his chambers.

"My lord...I have doubts as to if this...plan of Belimon's will really succeed." Merucrymon offered.

Cherubimon's face curled into a frown. He wanted a zero xhance of failure.

"Elaborate."

"Even eith Beliamon's ruse, the children will begin to suspect something eventually. And once they see that we've cut off their escape, they'll be positive."

"Yes, but they'll still be trapped." Cherubimon countered.

"But what to keep them from continuing to eat the meat apples. Surely after they figure out that they've been tricked, any time devoted to stuffing themsleves wil be diverted to getting out of their prison and rescuing their friend. And speaking of this friend, the one who holds Light, we havn't even heard of how he's progressing."

Cherubimon's frown deepened. Mercurymon had a point.

"If it comes to that, we'll empoly Beliamon again. She'll just have to fatten them all up at once, but seperately, so as not to cause trouble. As for the Holder of Light, Duskmon arrived on what was left on Ayzahn Ra earlier, but I've yet to hear anything yet."

"You're spying on Beliamon?" Ranamon questioned, slightly shocked.

"Yes. When we last spoke, she seemed a bit...strange. Almost as if her time with the boy had lessened her loyalty to me and Lord Lucemon," Cherubimon said, thinking.

"You honestly think she'd betray us? She knows what you'd do to her." Ranamon said, still skeptical.

"Anything is possible, Ranamon." CHerubimon responded sagely and sighed.

"Mercurymon, continue to oversee Grumblemon and Arbormon until they finish. Ranamon, before you return, fertilize as many trees as you can, without being seen of course, to promote fertility and bounty in the meat apple trees. I want them to have the best and most fattenign apples available. After you all finisg, report back to me. By that time, I may have heard from Duskmon." Cherubimon ordered as he turned off the communication device.

"Yes, my lord." Both Ranamon and Mercurymon stated before the device went out.

"Soon...soon those foolish children will be out of my way. Soon they will be too large to do anything to stop me!" Cherubimon said to himself, as dark, deranged, evil digimon often do, and waited for his Dark Warriors to return.
134122112112111122.title: Feasting and Spying

choices: At the hot springs, with Kouji...
1341221121121111221.content:
Kouji and Beliamon were now just steps away from the keep underground in the belltower. However, it was easier said than done. Upon entry, Beliamon had to, again, light the way using a ball of flame she apparated slightly above the palm of her hand.

Even though the strong gates that once barred the outer walls were all missing, getting to the keep was still a challenge, as there was a somewhat mazelike interior. Thick, sturdy wooden doors appeared every now and again in the passages, although many were bolted or equipped with heavy, rusty, iron chains, padlocks, or rings. Some were even boarded up with lumber.

Oddly, Kouji noted that there was little to no dust in the area. He kept on following Beliamon, who strangely seemed more intent on observing the walls or the floor than the path she was taking. She knocked her idle hand against the wall every now and again without a second thought, intently listening closely for something.

Kouji stepped softly and tried to remain as quiet as possible, so that he might hear whatever it was Beliamon was listening for. After several, similar turns and about five minutes, Kouji gathered that they had just carefully paced and listened to the same walls three times. They were going in circles...

"Hey, Beliamon?" Kouji asked, his voice a little heavy in his throat for not speaking for a while.

"Yes?" the golden haired Digimon replied, turning to face him. Kouji and Beliamon were now just steps away from the keep underground in the belltower. However, it was easier said than done. Upon entry, Beliamon had to, again, light the way using a ball of flame she apparated slightly above the palm of her hand.
"Uhm... well, where exactly is this keep?" the dark haired boy questioned.

"Well, er, it's..." she started, before suddenly, Beliamon leaned back, so her hand hit a certain stone in the wall. Spinning around, she quickly knocked it out of the wall, fished her hand in the hollow, and removed a gray key, "I knew it was hidden somewhere within these walls," Beliamon smirked, her grin twitching weakly as she returned the stone to the wall.

"You mean you were looking for a key the whole time?" the slightly pudgy boy raised his eyebrows as he placed his hands in his pockets.

"Well... yes, this is how to get into the basement keep where the food is stored. All the doors are locked after all," Beliamon nodded as she turned down the hall, motioning for Kouji to follow.

"But you couldn't just first try to knock the door down or pick the locks?" Kouji doubted, "It seems pretty lucky that you just reached your hand out and-"

"I could do many things," Beliamon retorted, "But I choose not to. Anyway, don't worry about it, Kouji," she said, turning the key in a rather bulky looking padlock, "We're almost there..." she said almost silently as the padlock fell to the ground with a crash. Beliamon pulled away the chains that bound the door locked and placed them off to the side, the links clinking against one another. She put her hands on the iron ring and gave a swift pull as the wooden door creaked open.

Beliamon increased the flame burning above the palm of her hand as she descended down a cool, steep, stone staircase; strangely, they weren't damp at all. Kouji didn't fear the vast, unknown that lay below him, the great darkness, with Beliamon standing near him, illuminating wherever the two stepped.

How could he even honestly THINK he felt safe with his captor!?

As she stepped down the staircase, whenever she passed by a torch post, she lit it, putting some of the flame near her hand on the unlit torch, spreading light where she passed. Kouji followed Beliamon as the two descended several flights of stairs, and with every landing they passed, the way became brighter and brighter. Soon, Kouji could see the bottom as light spread to the depths of the room.

Soon, as if in a dream, Kouji felt his foot hit solid ground. Beliamon then went to light any torches in the corner of the room, fully illuminating the entire vastness of the keep, bringing the fullness of the room apparent to Kouji's eyes.

Beliamon dropped her backpack onto the ground with a plop. Stretching out her arms for a bit, she sighed. Nonetheless, Beliamon soon picked her backpack up again and started for a large, sturdy set of sliding doors, similar to those in a western saloon except for the fact that they covered the full entryway, stained a deep, dark red. Engraved all over the door were obscure runes similar to those that Kouji noticed here and there there over the city ruins and even certain parts of the Digital World.

Beliamon made a motion for him to follow her. The now borderline chubby boy in blue could only guess that she was heading towards the store. Kouji increased his pace to keep up with her, sadly noting the small bouncing of his belly with his steps. He certainly had gotten some excercise done today, and hopefully he had lost a pound or two by the time they returned back to the Temple... if they were even going to go back there.

Suddenly, Beliamon made an quick, gasping noise in her throat that lasted half a moment, almost undetected by Kouji's ears. But Beliamon stood there, frozen, turned away from Kouji, her arms straight against her sides.

"Beliamon?" Kouji asked, with a strange, creeping feeling beginning to surround him, "Are you alright?"

A few seconds of silence pulsed on throughout the room... but a few seconds can seem all the longer when they bar the way to what one anticipates.

Beliamon's head was, again, turned to the ground. Kouji's eyes widened when he saw some shapes lined up near the wall. Rags? Bedsheets? Pillows? All of them were faded, dusty, and hadn't been touched in a while... but there were many of them surrounding the walls.

Kouji now could see how the staircase wound to the side of the walls, the landings were confined to the corners, and he fathomed that the entryway was somewhere way up there on a ledge... it had to be some tremendous refuge the two of them were in- almost the size of four basketball courts, paired two by two. Hundreds, maybe thousands of people could fit in here.

"Never mind," Beliamon said, trying to reassure Kouji, shaking her head and biting her lip, "I'm fine," she grinned falsely, placing both her hands onto the large doors to the food store. Kouji lined up next to her and tried to push the doors along with her... they were heavier than he thought, but the doors both swung open, revealing a somewhat dark room.

"Here we are," Beliamon said, her mood brightening up a little. Quickly lighting a few, ornate, paper lanterns using her magic, the store was soon brightened up. Kouji could see that it wasn't your average kitchen cabinet. There was a central walkway dividing the room into two columns of aisles of cabinets and shelves to the back wall. Then, lined up to the wide shelves were sliding ladders, which could reach the higher shelves. There was even a platform above, reaching from shelf to shelf.

Beliamon immediately went from one shelf to the next, hurrying and scuttering about with her backpack in hand, observing the rows of shelves, pulling out a few drawers and examining their contents. Kouji just stood, watching her blankly as she managed to stuff a large jar of flour, sugar, a box of eggs, several cartons of milk, a container of what was supposedly a cake of yeast into her backpack. Beliamon pushed the drawers back into place and picked up her backpack, which Kouji could tell was already quite hefty.

"Is that all?" Kouji grumbled meekly, raising an eyebrow.

"Oh no, no, no," Beliamon laughed, "These are only basic ingredients- I could barely make more than bread and maybe sugar cookies with just this, but then again... you might be amazed with what I could make in a pinch."

Hefting the backpack up, Beliamon crossed the corridor quickly as she began to take out sacks that were found in another drawer and fill them with things like apples, raisins, and melons.

"It's hard to imagine how much is still left in here," Beliamon commented, as she put a block of cheese into the backpack.

"Yeah," Kouji remarked, not sure of what to say, watching as Beliamon struggled to put a large bag of rice into her backpack, "Uhm... how is this all fitting?"

"Magic, silly," Beliamon giggled before going back to stuff her backpack with more food. Kouji sighed and ran a hand though his hair... Melancholy and depressed one moment, but gradually becoming bouncy and a little bubbly a while after... would he ever be able to fully understand her?

"You look a little wiped out," Beliamon noted as Kouji wiped a bead of sweat off of his forehead, "Why don't you go take a rest while I pack up, or maybe..." Beliamon stopped, but continued to suggest, "When was the last time you took a bath?"

"What?" Kouji exclaimed, slightly alarmed.

"No, no, I didn't mean you reek or anything," Beliamon smiled, holding up her hands in peace, "You saw the stream, right? There should be a hot spring off to the eastern side of the bank close to the city, and there are towels there, both hot and dry- why don't you go there and relax for a bit? It should be perfectly safe if you strictly stay to the hot spring area and don't go wandering off to the far reaches of the river."

"Well..." Kouji said, considering the idea. He wouldn't mind a nice, hot, relaxing bath at all. In fact, it seemed desirable. Too good to be true, almost.

"Hold on," Kouji started, "I'm supposed your prisoner, right?"

"Well, again, there's nowhere to run off to- but this is the first time I've ever heard a prisoner telling his captor her job," Beliamon stated smugly, "And what, you'd want me watching you take a bath?"

"No, no!" Kouji cried, now it was himself holding his hands up in peace, "It's just that... oh, I don't know," he sighed, "Sure, I'll go. Could you give me any hints on where to find it so I don't spend most of my time finding my way?"

"It's right by the remains of the house with the red roof," Beliamon noted, suddenly with a tinge of sadness, as if she remembered something special about it that now ceased to be, "I'll wait for you in front of the belltower when I'm done, so that's where you can find me," she smiled.

"Alright... I guess I'll see you later then," Kouji said awkwardly as he walked out, pushing the doors with the spells on them aside. Beliamon watched as they closed behind him.

***

Beliamon began to wonder if she had made a mistake in letting Kouji free to the hot springs for a while. It wasn't that she felt he would acquire a new sense of freedom and rebel against her; no, she wouldn't believe that in a thousand years. She hadn't been a good tyrant to him, after all, and Kouji didn't seem like he was about ready to do that do her.

As mentioned before, he had nowhere to run off to... but what was worrying Beliamon was Duskmon. Kouji was absolutely defenseless without his digivice... However, Beliamon was almost certain that he was stuck in the labyrinths of the Temple of Earth, and was struggling to find his way around. She had sensed him moving around outside the Temple, and she could only fathom that he was still in there.

Hopefully, the Warrior of Darkness was still at bay.

But aside from that, there was another thing clouding her thoughts, the instigator of all the terrible memories she held and had to relive with every step she took in this dead, deserted city.

Cherubimon.

That twisted, fallen angel of a Digimon was still monitoring her, perhaps even closer now than ever. He was the reason why the risk of Duskmon was about in the area. She could have almost sworn he was oblivious of her exact location, seeing it was, for the most part, cut off from the rest of the Digital World, but he had to have known if he were to despatch Duskmon.

She couldn't allow herself to feebly be afraid of him, but she had to admit that he was very, very powerful, and she should know he very well had the power in him to destroy her several times over. Plus, he had the backing of Lucemon, a power incomprehensibly greater than he.

She was in enough hot water seeing that she had only proceeded in her plan on only one child. The fattening of the others was a cheaper, backup scheme that he had concocted only minutes before conferring with Cherubimon a while ago. But that wasn't the only reason the Dark Lord had to be angry with her, for Kouji had barely fattened up since she captured him.

Cherubimon's face was seething with a feeling that he had been betrayed by her. Beliamon knew that he sensed something wrong with her, and she also feared that in the back of his mind, he recognized her from long ago somehow...

Beliamon had been summoned by him to do a task... to fatten the chosen children up for him, a task that she was recognized as specializing in for some reason.

Packing baking chocolate into her backpack furiously, Beliamon wondered what to do. Cherubimon wanted progress from the Warrior of Light and he wanted it fast. But what could she do? More importantly, why would she do it other than to save her own neck?

There was always the possibility of her conjuring food up with magic, but no... that would be wrong.

Sure, it would drain a little energy out of her, but that was nothing she couldn't get back with a little sleep. It was just that when she... magicked up food, it was... perfect. It tasted delightful and never ceased to please, and maybe it could be considered a little addictive. Perhaps her magical confections could be thought of something far and beyond the caliber of her homemade foods, the like of which Kouji had only eaten thus far.

By using magic, she could do many things; one of them was to instantly cause something like a cake to appear by apparating ingredients immediately and using magic to combine and cook it all in the same instant, using memories of how the food was prepared; it was all very complicated and hard to do, but she had mastered it.

The magicked food could be very fattening, and it could probably speed up his gain make him more willing to food, but very unnaturally. Beliamon was almost sure he would eat the meals she cooked if he completely trusted her.

It wouldn't be fair to Kouji if she were to give him magicked-up food, she thought as she stuffed several varieties of fish into the backpack before zipping it up.

She hated the thought of abusing Kouji's trust, especially seeing that Kouji was one of the few out there she had trust in at all...

Beliamon sighed, shook her head, cleared her thoughts, and struggled to heave the incredibly heavy backpack onto her back. She proceeded to carry it to another aisle as she still had some things she wanted to load into it before she headed up.
1341221121121111221.title: A Question of Trust

13412211211211112211.content:
Kouji sighed as the steamy waters of the hot spring seemed to massage his joints as he leaned deeper into the water.

He had taken Beliamon's advice and followed her directions accordingly to find the hot spring, hidden behind the red-roofed house. Upon arriving, he'd spied a dilapidated changing stall and was amazed to find a few bathing suits strewn about, and human ones at that.

'Though...Beliamon is human enough for a digimon...I guess there could have been others.' Kouji thought as he absently put a hand on his belly, grimacing as he did so.


He'd been lucky that he'd been able to squeeze into the tiny garmant. Even now, he feared the elastic band would break, leaving him unclothed and forcing him to sprint back to the changing tent.

Kouji sighed and examioned his small paunch, calmly sitting in his lap under the water. While he wasn't fat, he wasn't anywhere near being thin. He had gained enough wait to inhibit him in swimming and running at least.

Kouji drew his knees to his chest.

'And enough for people to tease me again, too..' he mumbled bitterly.

Now that he had a full view of his body, Kouji also noticed other parts of him with increasing in size as well. His chest, if ever so slightly, had began to pooch out just. His legs no touched and rubbed together where there had once been empty space.

Grumbling and trying to clear his head, Kouji pushed out from the sides of the hot spring and just let himself float, staring up at the gray sky.

Kouji grumbled again.

His pale belly stuck up out of the water like an island jutting up from the ocean, almsot obscuring his toes.

It seemed no matter what he did, he couldn't get his weight off of his mind.

Sighing, Kouji returned to his previous position and absently wondered what Beliamon was doing.


***

A young Kouji slurped happily as he finished off what was left of his chocolate ice cream cone, stains of the cold, chocolate confection littered around his mouth.

Behind him, his father and stepmother were both lying on a large beach blanket under an umbrella. His father had his hands behind his head, a look of bliss on his face, as he snoozed away, letting the sun tan him. His stepmother was flipping through a book and wearing a large sun hat.

"Mom..?" Kouji asked, getting up from his own place in the sand and waddling over to his stepmother, "Will you buy me another ice cream?"

Kouji's stempmother, glanced up from her book and gave her stepson a worried look.

Frankly, she didn't know where the boy was putting it all. Ever since she had married Kouji's father, she had watched her stepson grwo in size, and he wasn't the thinnest kid then, perhaps a little pudgey, but nothing serious.

Now her stepson was bordering on becoming a full-fledged butterball. Kouji's skin was pale, from staying inside and watching television all day, and his stomach balooned out over the rim of his swimming trunks and fell over like a cascade.

Setting her book aside, she supposed it was partly her fault as well.

Kouji hadn't accepted this new woman in his life that well and acted as if she was the plague. She had taken to giving the boy anything he wanted to accept her, including food, but now, she was really beginning to start to worry about the boy.

"Don't you think you've had enough, Kouji?" she asked, not wanting to hurt her stepson's feelings.

"But I'm hungry..." the young boy whined, placing a hand on his stomach.

"Kouji, we ate just an hour ago, and that was your second ice cream cone since we got here...." Kouji's stepmother tried to reason.

"I don't care! I want another ice cream!" Kouji shited and stamped his foot down, bordering on a temper tantrum.

Kouji's stepmother smiled awkwardly as a few other parents and children stared at her and Kouji, hearing his shouting.

Sighing, Kouji's stepmohther shook her head and sat up, latching onto Kouji's hand to take him over to the ice cream stand.

"Now, listen Kouji: THis is the last one, okay?" she asked him, to which he nodded enthusiastically.

***


Kouji blushed as he recalled the memory.

'I guess I really should have listened to her more...maybe then, I wouldn't have gotten so big...' Kouji thought.

He was glad that he had indeed lost the weight during the growth spurts of puberty. If not, he could still have been that heavy.

***


"Kouji?" Kouji heard his dad's vouice sound throughout the new house, the third so far this year.

"Yeah, Dad?" A pre-adolescent Kouji asked, not really paying attention as he watched some rerun on television and munched on a bag of potato chips.

"Could you come here a moment?" his dad asked.

Kouji sighed, grunting as he got up and proceeded to follow his dad's voice, eding up in the dining room.

"Take a seat, son." His dad commanded as Kouji noticed the troubled look on his dad's face, as well as his stepmother's, seated beside his father.

Kouji did as he was told, the chair creaking under his weight.

"Kouji...we've been worrying about you...more specifically your weight." his father said, trying to ease into the conversation gently.

Kouji bristled and he immediately sent an angry glare to his stepmother.

"SHE talked to you again didn't she?" he asked accusingly, his stepmother recoiling at the look he sent her.

"It doesn't matter. Kouji, look at yourself. You literally eating yourself to death! Your hlaf MY weight, and I'm four times as old as you are." his father pointed out.

"SO WHAT?! I know I'm fat! I don't need you, or HER, or anybody else telling me!" Kouji shouted, getting up and leaving the dining room in a frenzy.

"Kouji-" his stepmother started to call after him, but Kouji was already halfway to his room.

Once there, he slammed the door behind him, locked it, and let himself fall to the floor against it, hugging his knees.

He knew they were right. Its just...he didn't care anymore. He'd tried to lose the weight in the past, but he'd just ended up getting heavier. They moved, usually, more than twice a year, he never had any friends...

Truly, he was terrified of how chubby he'd became. The taunts behind his back in school, not being able to keep up in gym class, staying indoors during summer while everyone else went to the beach...but then again, he never stayed anywhere long enough to make any friends, so why care what others say about him?

Sighing and supressing his feelings, Kouji rose from the floor and went over and flopped on his bed.

Hopefully, he'd have a few growth spurts in puberty and the weight would melt away.

***

Kouji shuddered, despite the hot water.

That had been one one of worst moments in his life, an everpresent reminder of what his life had been like when he'd been larger.

Kouji chuckled darkly.

'Of course, then, there hadn't been anyone to be fat with...' Kouji thought, referring to Takuya and the others.

A frown then formed on Kouji's face.

'The again, they've probably lost all the weight by now...' he thought glumly, looking up at the sky.

Takuya would never let him live it down.

Sighing grumpily, Kouji submerged himself in the hot water to refresh himself.

"Shouldn't Beliamon be here by now?" The blunette asked himself wondering how long his captor was going to spend in the belltower.

Kouji paused a moment to think over what he had just asked himself.

"Oh, well. Not my problem." he muttered, trying his best to get back to relaxing.

Meanwhile....
13412211211211112211.title: Memories in the Hot Spring

134122112112111122112.content:
Takuya plopped back onto the soft, green grass and sighed after he had tossed away another bare apple core. "Ahh..." he relaxed, letting his now bulky body bask in the warmth of the sun, "Now, this is the life!"

Suddenly, a gigantic, pink, meat apple hurtled through the air and knocked Takuya square in the head.

"You already said that yesterday, and look what good it brought you!" shouted a girl's voice from beyond. Takuya struggled to sit up straight, his head still spinning from the impact, with his large, soft, and heavy gut now becoming an obstacle. Now it was like the hardest sit-up in his life... The goggle head struggled to use his stomach muscles, now covered in thick flab, to pick himself up. After much work and sweat, Takuya managed to sit upright.

"Ow..." he moaned, rubbing the area where the projectile meat apple had hit, "What was that for?"

"To get your attention for one," explained the blonde haired girl wearing a purple beanie, "Honestly, after putting up such an act with Kouji... I thought you were really concerned about your weight."

"Meh, it will all shed off once Kouji returns and we're running all over the Digital World again. Trust me on this on, Zoe," Takuya smiled, giving her a thumbs-up as he picked up the large meat apple from where it had landed and dusted it off with his yellow shirt. Even as he stretched it slightly so he could clean it, his potbelly, now larger than ever spilled out from under his shirt. His exposed pudgy gut revealed its soft rolls and the deep navel Takuya now possessed.

After Takuya had finished cleaning the apple, he let his shirt loose, but it started to ride up. "Shoot! Not again..." he grumbled behind clenched teeth. He then proceeded to yank his T-shirt over his oversized belly.

"Sure, sure, whatever you say, Takuya," Zoe grinned, giving Takuya a skeptical look. It was true, though. He was even bigger from the day before... his face was rounded and he was on the verge of having a double chin. His arms seemed now thickset, softer, and flaccid, and Takuya's tan pants looked painted on and painfully tight, maybe they were at the point of bursting. Even his chest was beginning to poof out with all the weight gained, as it appeared Takuya was developing slight, flabby breasts.

"Man, have you seen the size of the meat apples lately?" Takuya asked, almost drooling as he held the volleyball-sized apple in both hands before taking a bite into the plump, pink fruit.

"And you'd have me believe even that might make you stop?" Zoe shook her head as she placed her hands on her newly rounded, wider hips, "If they were fattening before, just imagine what they're going to do to us now..." she sighed deeply.

"Hey, a guy's gotta eat," Takuya stated with his mouth full, chewing off a chunk of the overly juicy fruit, some pink drops dripping down his chin.

Zoe began to crack a smile and laugh at the sight, "Takuya, sometimes you act like such a pig, you know?"

Takuya smirked but continued to chow down, until Zoe tapped him on the back. Takuya rose to his feet, his bulging belly jiggling as he stood upright, "What is it?" he asked, turning to face Zoe.

"I didn't cook that apple, Takuya. Isn't it bitter?" Zoe asked, a little concerned.

Takuya looked suprised down at the half-eaten apple he held in both his hands, "Well, if it wasn't, I couldn't taste a difference... it was warm and delicious, and maybe even better than any meat apple I've ever had. I haven't had one that tasted like turkey since who knows when..." he said, rubbing his belly tenderly.

"Gee, I don't know... Yesterday?" Zoe asked sarcastically before continuing, "It's really strange how the meat apples all grew to the size of melons overnight," Zoe observed, looking to see that the ripe meat apples were all at least the size of grapefruits and were either dangling, weighed down off of a branch or on the ground, "They've turned pink too." All the meat apples were a beige color before they were cooked.

"Meh, I noticed that too," Takuya nodded, licking the pink juices off his lips, "I guess that's because they're so plump and full of more juice than ever," he smiled, "Before you had to cook them to bring the juices out, but I guess that work's done already for some reason."

"Well, you've certainly become an expert on meat apples in the past few days," Zoe complimented, giving Takuya a pat on the back which caused his chubby stomach to bobble.

Just then, Tommy ran onto the scene, a meat apple cupped in between both hands, "Hey guys," he smiled. Even Tommy with his high metabolism was starting to pack on the pounds. His white shirt seemed tight and strained, as it was holding back a newly accumulated potbelly, which was only just beginning to peek out from under his shirt, "What's up?"

"Oh, you know... just teasing Takuya about his weight and considering a diet, the usual," Zoe smiled.

"Very funny, Zoe," Takuya sneered as he discarded the finished apple core.

Meanwhile...
