1341221121121111221121.content:
Merucrymon and Ranamon were silently observing the rounded children, hidden by the foliage of the meat apple grove. Both had slightly awed expressions on their faces.

"I must applaude you Ranamon. It appears that not only have you accelerated the growth process of the meat apples, but you've also eliminated the cooking process alltogether!" Mercurymon exclaimed.


"No problem, sugar. Its hard to believe that feisty little bunch of kids that from just a week ago have become so lazy!" Ranamon replied as she saw the forms of Takuya, Zoe, and Tommy vanish between the trees on the path pack to their campsite.

"Indeed. Lord Cherubimon was brilliant in devising this plan. You can see the effects in even the way they walk."

Mercurymon was right. The children, when being observed before by eiher himself, Ranamon or another Dark warrior, always carried themselves quickly and on guard of any possible attacks, but no more.

Now their strides were slower and more clumsy, and Mercurymon ventures that they hedn'y touched they're digivices since ythey had tried to contact their comrade, which Beliamon had taken care of by sending a false message, or so he was told.

'Not that they need their digivices now.' Mercurymon thought with a smirk. The area the children were in had always been free of inhabitants, even though it had always been bountiful. And now, thanks to Grumblemon and Arbormon deleting the data that made up the land around the grove, the kids were now trapped on a floating island of sorts. Nothing could get in and nothing could get out.

Now, Ranamon and himslef had been assigned to make sure the children never discovered that they had been trapped. For if they did, their whole plan could go up in smoke. Or a great portion of it, at least.

"Mercurymon, Ranamon." Both dark warriors attention were then drawn the the communication orb in the palm of Mercurymon's left hand as it flared to life and Cherubimon's face appeared.

"I trust everything goes as planned?" The dark digimon asked.

"Yes, my lord. Not only have the children gained weight, but they've also become extremely lazy and have been lulled into a false sense of security." Mercurymon stated.

"They also have never travelled to the edge of of their prison. The farthest they travel in a day is to get to the ripest and best tastin' meat apples, since the trees around their own campsite are practically bare." Ranamon added.

"And if they should somehow continue this process until they reach the edge of their island prison?" Cherubimon questioned, promting a smirk from Ranamon.

"If such an emergency arises, honey, I can make all the trees bountiful again in just a few seconds."

"Perfect. You'll have to gives the trees an extra watering before you leave then, Ranamon. I need both you and Mercurymonto go on another mission for me."

"Another task, my lord?" Mercurymon questioned. "Is not making sure the children do not discover their Shangri La is indeed a trap more important?"

"IF Ranamon makes sure all of the trees are bountiful, then I suspect they won't be going anywhere near the edge soon. Right now, there are rebellions rising up in what seem like every corner of the Digital World. I've already dispacthed Grumblemon and Arbormon to the south to crush the disturbances there. You two I need to send to the north to quell the digimon there. I may even have to recall Duskmon from his reconnaissance in Ayzahn Ra to destroy some minor disturbances in the west."

"That's quite a bit of rebellion, my lord." Merucurymon stated the obvious. "There hasn't been this much uproar since we had to destroy Ayzahn Ra in the east."

"Yes, I know. Another good reason for umprisioning those blasted children. It seems that whever they go they spread rebellion. All traces of rebellion have come from places at least one of them has visited. But back to mattes at hand. Mercurymon, return immeadiately. Ranamon, wait until night so you can water the trees without chance of being caught, then return as well."

"Understood." Both dark warriors chimed as the communication ordb went black once more.

"Remember, Ranamon: You cannot be caught under any cirumstances." Mercurymon warned as he began o telepory away.

Ranamon, in reply, rolled her eyes.

"I gotcha, sugar. I do have SOME brains, you know." She replied sarcastiaclly and turned and walked into thr trees, vanishing from Mercurymon's sight, to wait until darkness arrives and she could perform her duties.
1341221121121111221121.title: Observance and Rebellion.

13412211211211112211212.content:
That morning, Takuya was the first to wake up. He got dressed, then he groggily lumbered out of the tent. His eyes shot open when he saw the area around the campsite.

The meat apple trees that were devoid of meat apples just hours ago were now flourishing. The meat apples were now even bigger than ever, as they were now the size of pumpkins. There were quite a bit, as the few that were still attached to the trees rested on top of the small piles that had formed on the ground.

The fruits themselves were also different. They were still a pink color reminiscent of the middle of a rare steak. The stems were still the size of normal apples, and the meat apples were so huge that the stem no longer formed a pit. In addition, the cores were the same size as before, but due to the size of the apples, they no longer reached the bottom, leaving the bottoms smooth and flawless.

Takuya, in disbelief, walked up to one of the meat apples, inspecting them to see that they were actually real. He poked one, and to his surprise, it wobbled a bit. Seeing that they were real, Takuya could hardly contain his excitement, and he tried to lift it up, using both his arms to heave up the fruit. He brought it back to the campsite, then saw that Zoe and J.P. had waken up.

Upon seeing the new fruits, Zoe became suspicious. "What is this?" she questioned. Takuya dumbly responded, "They're meat apples, and they've gotten even bigger. These can last forever!" "Aren't you concerned about where these came from?" was Zoe's skeptical response. Takuya just said, "Who cares. They are probably delicious."

Zoe was not satisfied by this, so she expressed her concerns, saying, "We have already gained quite a bit of weight, and now we'll just gain even more. What if someone wants us to be fat?" J.P. finally spoke, saying, "She has a good point." This would cause concern in Cherubimon, however, due to the rebellions, no one was there to watch over the kids.

Either way, Takuya responded by saying, "You're just getting paranoid like always. I don't see why we can't enjoy this time off." This angered Zoe, who responded by saying, "You're so infuriating." She then stormed off, mumbling to herself, "I wish Kouji were here. He'd probably know what to do." Meanwhile, J.P. ran after her, and the two began talking.

***

Back at the campsite, Takuya walked over to one of the small heaps of fruit, and hefted up another one, bringing it closer to the campsite. He went to get a third one when he heard Tommy stir.

Tommy groggily walked outside in his pajamas, then he saw the new meat apples, and practically jumped out his pajamas in excitement. His pudgy belly jiggled as he did so. Either way, he exclaimed, "This is amazing! These meat apples are probably even better than the old ones!" Takuya responded with the same amount of enthusiasm, saying, "I know, this is amazing! I can't wait to try them!"

Either way, the two boys walked up to the tree, and continued to bring the fruit to the pile that Takuya had started. Takuya decided to heft a fruit in each hand, while Tommy found a big one that was four times the size of his head. It was so big that Tommy had to roll it to the pile. After a half of an hour, most of the trees near the campsite had no fruit left, and there was an immense pile of pumpkin-sized fruit in the middle of the campsite. The two boys were awestruck at the mere sight of the pile.

Tommy blurted out excitedly "C'mon! Let's eat!" He pick up a gargantuan fruit, and right before he dug in, Takuya interrupted him, saying "Wait! I have a better idea. Let's have an eating contest!" "That's a great idea!" was Tommy's eager response. "What does the winner get, though?" Tommy questioned. "I never really thought about that" Takuya responded. "How about the loser has to bring the winner more apples?" Tommy responded cockily, "I'm gonna win then."

The two sat down next to the pile, and they each brought a fruit in front of them. Takuya began by twisting the stem and pulling it out, like with any other apple. When he pulled it out, however, a small, white core came out with it, leaving just the flesh on the ground in front of him. Juices also started to leak out of the hole that he created. Seeing this, Tommy followed suit, and they both began digging in.

Takuya began by drinking the leaking juices, which tasted like gravy. It was amazing, delicious, and fattening. Takuya slurped down quite a bit of juice, then he began scooping out chunks of flesh with his hands. He ate the chunks, finding out that this apple tasted like a good steak. He ate with gusto, and every few bites, his stomach, which was already sticking out a bit, pushed out a little bit more.

Tommy took a slightly different approach. He held the bottom of the fruit, then stuck his face in the fruit, sloppily taking as many bites as he could. The juicy flesh left quite a bit of juice on his face, and his pajamas, which he was still wearing. His fruit tasted like roast chicken, and Tommy loved this flavor. His belly also grew a bit every few bites, becoming slightly more firm by the minute.

***

Meanwhile, back in the forest, Zoe and J.P. were talking.

"I'm concerned. Takuya won't listen to reason, he will just eat himself to death!" Zoe began. J.P. responded by saying, "I know. Soon, he will be to out of shape to defend himself. I don't want that to happen to me." "Maybe we should talk to Kouji about this." Zoe added. Then she got out her digivice, writing a long message explaining her situation. They then walked over to a nice, shady tree, and sat down, waiting for a response.
13412211211211112211212.title: Waking up to a Surprise

choices: Minutes later, Kouji sensed that somebody was coming.
1341221121121111221122.content:
Wisps of steam steadily continued to rise from the sweltry hot spring, making the air around it transform into a humid and moist very moist cloud. Somewhere within this floated a very bleary looking Kouji; now, even his face and shoulders had broken out into a heavy sweat. The dark haired boy's head started to spin as he began to feel light-headed and wobbly due to the heat.

With a gasp, Kouji took in as much dense air into his lungs as he could and swam off to the bank of the hot spring, away from the steam in the center. The swim was seemingly long and tiring, and by the time he reached the desired location, he was exhausted! He drew in a deep breath of the thinner, cold air as his entire body felt total relief from the deep humidity from before. With the cool air, his energy slowly began to return to him, and perhaps he felt more energized than before.

He clasped onto the side of the spring with both his hands and pushed up hard, trying to get his knees out of the water and onto the bank. It took him a while, but eventually Kouji managed to pick himself out of the water and sit on the edge.

Glistening with droplets of water, the blue haired boy sighed as he looked down at his plump abdomen protruding outward and softly resting in his lap. Kouji realized that swimming, or even getting out of the water was a more difficult task than ever before, due to his newfound pudge- perhaps it had been more than that... maybe a little bit of a struggle.

Shaking his head, Kouji told himself, "The heat must have gotten to my head; it probably made me a bit weaker," he assured before grinning slightly, "Although, it was boiling hot out there, so I probably burned off a few pounds just by sitting in the steam."

Catching sight of his chubby belly, Kouji let out a deep breath, "Aw... who am I trying to fool anyway?" Kouji's blue hair, now loose, untied, and drenched in water, hung halfway down his back at the longest. He also had wet locks of hair obscuring his forehead and draping a little over his eyes. He watched as a round, fat water droplet slided down a damp clump of his hair, and splash into the hot spring.

"Now, where did I put it?" Kouji asked himself as he searched the ground around him for the small, durable, blue rubber band he always used to tie his hair up. Bereft of this important device, Kouji's long hair would be awry and falling all over the place. A wet lock of hair flopped over Kouji's eyes and hindered his vision. Sighing, he parted it away with his hand as he bent down on his knees and began to scour his surroundings for that all-important rubber band.

However, as he bent down, he noticed his bathing suit, especially around his rear end, felt a smidge tighter than was comfortable. The blue haired boy shrugged to himself in annoyance, but wouldn't let it bother him. He already knew he was out of shape... it just kept on being brought to his attention one way after another.

Brushing away a few pebbles and parting away blades of grass seemed to yield no results. Kouji groaned in frustration as his lengthy hair cascaded over his vision for the umpteenth time. Why hadn't he been more careful with it? Or why did he take it off in the first place? He knew his blue mop of hair would get like this if he didn't... Sighing to himself again, Kouji gazed across to the horizon...

Immediately, he became enlightened once he peered over the hot springs. The boy with the slack blue hair gasped audibly as his eyes snapped open with astonishment.

Then came the conventional slap in the face, although the blow was softened by his hair which had fallen back in the nick of time.

The changing stall and the house with the red roof was standing on the OTHER side of the hot springs! Kouji must have been so light-headed in the heat that he floated all the way over to the opposite side of the springs, and if that wasn't bad enough, he didn't realize it until just now.

Trudging back to the bank of the spring with a somewhat defeated look on his face, Kouji Minamoto edged the hot springs to reach the changing stall where he bet he had left his vital band. He didn't swim across the spring like he did last time because he didn't want to risk having his vision obscured by his loving locks in the clouds of hot steam; Kouji noticed that the temperature in the steam cloud had probably risen even more, and the steamy whisps extended closer to the edges. Now he was grateful he didn't rough it.

Again, Kouji pushed up and got his partially flaccid legs out of the water before walking off to the changing stall to fetch his band. He looked down to see his belly jiggling very slightly with his every step, just too much for his own comfort...

He wasn't planning on getting dressed right away; he'd just straighten his hair off and head back to the water... maybe to sit by the edge with his feet dipped, letting the rest of his body to dry, or maybe to get back in if Beliamon didn't show up anytime soon.

He became a little at rest when he discovered his hairband was resting on an ivory colored basin near the side opposite the large rows of changing stalls. A mirror lay above the basin, and he was able to tie his mess of hair up, pushing the renegade locks away, in no time.

Kouji headed back out to the edge where he sat for a few minutes, gazing into the steamy water. He tried to just lay back and get some more relaxation after his little fiasco swimming across the hot spring, but there was a few pressing matters on his mind.

Again, Kouji wondered what exactly was delaying his captor, or, if not that, simply taking her so long... he had easily been gone for about an hour and a half, and he didn't think Beliamon was one to become lost in Ayzahn Ra, especially when she knew of his own location. After a while, he idly began to drum his legs with his hands, and to his vexation, there also was a slight jiggle.

He turned his face towards the gray skies... not a cloud up there for him to wonder about; they were just gray, stolid, and never changing...
1341221121121111221122.title: Trying to Relax

choices: When Beliamon exits, Kouji is waiting for her?
Beliamon goes back to the hot spring to get Kouji.
13412211211211112211221.content:
"And that's IT!" Beliamon cried triumphantly as she slumped over her backpack, sweat pouring down her face and her hair a mass of tangles and knots.

She truly had needed to shop, especially if the Temple of Earth was no longer the safe haven it had once been.

Sighing was more, but decideing it was high time she got out of the belltower, Beliamon hoisted herself up from her position on the floor against her backpack and tried to lift the thign, but no no avail.

"Ah, to heck with it." Beliamon muttered, and using a generous amount of magic, levitated the backpack, near bursting point, and creating a ball of flame for light in her palm once again, began the trek back out of the Belltower, cringing once again as she past the area with beddings.

'This...must have been where they made thier final stand...' She thought sorrowly as she turned her head back to the path ahead.

It was still too painful. It was STILL too painful after all these years. A whole city destroyed; because of her. So many lives lost; because of her. Teacher...deleted while defending her. And her friends. Tara...Rao...Eri..and...Yoi. All perishing in a fight she herself brought about.

Beliamon stopped momentarily and punched the ancient wall with her free hand as the hot tears began to roll off of her face.

If only she hadn't been so cocky! She thought...she thought that if they banded together they would be able to defeat him. But it was all for nothing. The elders had warned her, but she hadn't listened. Instead, she captivated her peers, Ayzahn Ra's younger gerneation. And after she had convinced the young to fight, what choice did the old have but to fight as well? They certainly would not let their students go into battle without their aide. So the old then joined the young in their fight.

'And then what happened, Beliamon? What happened after the older generation joined the young and Ayzahn Ra began rebelling?' Beliamon asked herself sarcastically as she pounded the wall again.

Slumping to the floor, Beliamon replied in a voice so soft, she herself could barely hear it: "They were deleted. All of them. Except for me."

"You seem troubled, Beliamon." a voice suddenly sounded from the darkness, and Beliamon gasped.

Standing, and firously wiping away her tears, she cursed herself. She had been so lost in her emotions that she had not sensed the dark presence worm its wat out from the cavernous Temple of Earth and into the city, into the very belltower.

"M-my lord Duskmon, what...brings you here?" Beliamons asked the darkness, her voice a little shaky.

"It is none of your business why I am here." Duskmon replied simply as he materialized from out of the darkness.

Of course, Beliamon did know why he was there. He was there to spy on her. She was also faily certain that he knew that she knew he had been in the Temple of Earth, if that made any sense at all.

Rising up to her full stature and smoothing her dress some, Beliamon tried to seem as taciturn as possible.

"Of course, my lord. Do you desire anything of me then?" Beliamon asked coolly.

If possible, an awkward look came over Duskmon's face then.

"You seemed..troubled. I simply wished to know what had been bothing you." Duskmon replied in any even more awkward fashion, and for a moment Beliamon was struck dumb.

A Dark Warrior, one of Cherubimon's right hand digimon, and the Warrior of Darkness no less, had just shown HER compassion?!

There was something wrong with that picture.

"Oh...I see. Thank you my lord, but I was just overcome by the past for a moment there." Beliamon replied, still a bit awed.

Whether this was a plausible answer or not, Duskmon nodded and the two stood again in a strnage silence.

Duskmon was still looking at Beliamon awkwardly, but she had abandoned her awed expression and was studying Duskmon closely.

"...I expect everything goes well with my counterpart?" He asked afte quite a pause.

"Yes. Everthing goes fine with Warrior of Light. He's bathing right now, in fact. If I'm lucky, the minerals in the hot spring I sent him to will have slowed his metabolsim down a bit." Beliamon replied with not even thinking, she was still looking hard a Duskmon.

Something about him seemed familiar...

Suddenly, a picture of Kouji ran through her mind and Beliamon gasped. With Kouji's picture came another and with that picture came even more. Memories, names...and a mission.

'It can't be...is it even possible? Do either of them know?' Thought ran through Beliamon like bullets for a moment before Duskmon again snapped her out of them.

"Beliamon? Are you positive you're well? For a moment there you looked as if you had..."

"I'm fine, my lord. I apologize for my...lightheadedness today. i just realized that Darkness is Light's reflection." Beliamon said with a smile.

Duskmon looked at her surously and was about to ask a question when the communication orb strapped to his waist came to life.

He immeadiately abandoned all rpervious thought and focused his attention to his master.

"Report Duskmon? Have you noticed anything strange about Beliamon?" Cherubimon's voice rang out and reverbrated through the large undergroud room.

Duskmon looked awkwardly at Beliamon and Beliamon smiled wickedly.

It was too good to pass up.

Beliamon strode over next to Duskmon to where she could be seen through the orb as well, and with as much gusto she possesssed, gave Cherubimon a big smile and exclaimed: "Lord Cherubimon! How are things back at the castle?"

For a moment, Cherubimon just stared blakly as Beliamon, then switching to Duskmon and then back to Beliamon again before he made a rather strange sound like a Duckmon being roasted alive.

"Beliamon! Err...how goes it with the Warrior of Light?" the dark lord asked, trying to cover up his tracks.

"Quite well, my lord. Progress is coming along smoothly. In fact, I just restocked my supply of ingredients." Beliamon replied, still smiling.

"Wonderful. I knew I could rely on you Beliamon." Beliamon almost laughed there but quickly caught herself as Cherubimon turned his attention to Duskmon. "Duskmon, I need you to return to the castly immeadiately. There are several rebellions going on in various corners of the Digital World and I nned to sedn you to crush one of them. Leave as soon as possible."

"Understood." Duskmon replied as Cherubimon faded from the communication orb.

With a small snigger, Beliamon returned to her previous position in front of Duskmon and smiled amiably.

"So I take you'll be leaving now, my lord Dusmon?" She asked playfully.

"Err...yes. I must return to Lord Cherubimon as soon as possible." Duskmon replied as he began to telport away, back to Cherubimon's lair.

"I see. Well it was nice talking to you," Beliamon's eyes locked on Duskmon and she smirked just as Duskmon was practically gone. "Kouichi."

Duskmon's eyes widened at the name, but just as fast, he was whisked back to CHerubimon's castle.

Beliamon chuckled to herself again. Oh, what a discovery she had just made.

'This may cause complication to arise in the future, though.' She thought as she levitated her backpack again and resumed her trek out of the Belltower to rendezvous Kouji.

But she suposed she could deal with that when the time came.
13412211211211112211221.title: Encounter with Duskmon

choices: Beliamon and Kouji stop somewhere for a while
134122112112111122112212.content:
"Well, it sure did take long enough..." Kouji grumbled as soon as he had noticed his captor's arrival. He didn't turn around to face her, but remained still in his position, sitting off the edge of the hot spring. His legs were submerged into the warmth of the waters, and he had wrapped his arms around his knees. He gazed out to the clouds of steamy mist toward the middle of the spring out in the distance... swiftly they rose, opening their faint maws to breath in the world, extending their ghostly talons to grasp the air, but all too soon vainly getting dissolved by the cold. And once the steam wisps had evaporated, there was nothing to look out in the distance, not even the sky. Just the ominous, grey nothing.

"What, did you miss me?" Beliamon smiled slightly, her voice containing traces of jest. Kouji jerked, but glared into the water instead, watching his own face flush, and declined to retort. Then there was quiet until a soft thud sounded as Beliamon allowed her overloaded backpack to gently float to the ground. She hopped onto a low, fairly smooth rock in their midst.

Even as she faced Kouji's backside, she could observe progress... if she really wanted to call it that... Still, he had to smile when she noticed the soft rolls of love handles developing on the once lithe, now burgeoning waist of the youth. The direct results of her own cooking, no doubt... and one more reason for her 'prisoner' to be so troubled, no doubt.

Kouji turned his head around to finally look at Beliamon. "I guess I'm not the only one who's been reminiscing..." Beliamon thought as she noticed there was something lying underneath his dark blue eyes, a kind of cloudy depth and distance in his pupils. At least Beliamon was now in better spirits since her own unwelcome recollections at the belltower, thanks to her awkward little run-in with Cherubimon and revelation about Duskmon; so it was very lucky that at both of them weren't in a moody attitude...

...still, Beliamon remembered long ago, when someone special she knew well was taking a much deserved break in the hot springs...

Trying to break more than one sheet of figurative ice, Beliamon remarked, "So, have we been enjoying ourselves?"

"Yeah, I guess," Kouji shrugged before rising to his feet. He was wearing nothing but a blue bathing suit that could have probably have fit him just fine a while ago, but now almost looked a smidgen too tight for comfort. To add to his, his bulging paunch was now starting to slightly drape over his bathing suit. The few water droplets that were still scattered about his body started to slide down as he stood up. The blue-haired boy had broken out in a vivid blush as he approached Beliamon; obviously, he detested having to display most of his flabby, out-of-shape body, in front of the one who was supposed to be his captor, nonetheless.

Kouji halted, tilted his eyes up from the ground to Beliamon's eyes, and opened his mouth, as if he were about to say something... but just continued on his destination of the changing stalls to scope out a towel and retrieve his clothes. Beliamon couldn't tell if it were sweatdrops from the hot spring or sweatdrops from sheer humiliation that dripped down his forehead.

***

"How many days has it been?" Kouji questioned as the two wandered through the cobbled streets that were dilapidated with age and wear.

"About three," Beliamon answered curtly, "Why?"

"Three?" Kouji repeated, "Well, I guess that must be right... it seems a little longer than that, you know?" he nodded as he looked back up at the grey nothing where the skies should have been. Again, his eyes kept on searching past all that distance for something to focus on, but to no avail, as he had to turn away when they started to strain.

"I wonder what the others are doing?" Kouji thought to himself as he continued to walk with Beliamon through the pathways of the ruined city, "It's been three days- they've got to suspect something's wrong by now..." Then he sighed and smiled sarcastically, "Sure, even if they've already set out and are looking for me, it's really likely they'll end up finding THIS place, all isolated from the rest of the world, literally floating around in the middle of nowhere."

Beliamon and her alleged prisoner passed by a crumbling, ancient fountain, dry as a bone- and as pale as one too! The largest, bottom basin was very large, broken out in cracks, and probably had a diameter of around thirty feet. The lopsided ruins of a destroyed second bowl remained on a low-lying, decaying pillar, and it was a real wonder why it didn't topple over and crumble into a cloud of dust and rubble. Then Kouji looked up and saw somewhat of a dim glint and noticed an strangely shaped formation of what seemed to be copper holding it in place.

"That used to be a fountain- oh, and that used to be a statue," Beliamon explained as she saw Kouji observing the distorted figure barely holding the fountain together, "It used to be quite something... but now, you can see, all that settled to the bottom is dust and... coins..." she swallowed as she noticed the dark silvers and coppers still lying there.

Kouji blinked, "Hey, we've never passed this way before... we're not heading toward the Temple of Earth, are we?" he asked, looking at her with analytical eyes.

"No, not right now," Beliamon said honestly as she re-levitated her backpack and continued, away from the fountain. Kouji hesitated and wished he had a little more information, but advanced along with her anyway.

Kouji let out a deep breath. If only he had ended up with the unrelenting, stereotypical evil villain for his captor, someone who reveled in torture and hated his prisoner to the core of his being, but was entirely incompetant and could easily be outsmarted...

But with Beliamon... she was much more complex than that- bouncy and cheerful one second, and completely solemn the next- just like before he had left for the hot springs, and even when she had returned to fetch him, he noticed she was exuding some invisible aura of merriment, there was definitely a jovial glint in her eyes. Kouji had entirely mixed feelings about her and no idea whether he was right or not...

True, she may be working for Cherubimon and she was supposed to be holding him captive, but... she wasn't being very diabolical about it as one might expect. When all was said and done, under the thrall of Beliamon, the worst she'd actually done to him was try to feed him, if not very generously at that.

"Ahh... Kouji, what are you complaining about?" Kouji asked himself in thought as the two of them turned a corner, "Do you really want things to get worse than they already are?"
134122112112111122112212.title: The Captor and Prisoner Reunited

1341221121121111221122121.content:
"Ah....why don't we stop here for a bit of a rest, Kouhi?" Beliamon asked a bit tiredly, stooping down and letting her heavy pack fall to the ground.

The bandanna-clad boy have her a curious look.

"You're tired already? We havn't walked that far at all." Kouji stated, crossing his arms and giving his companion/captor a scrutinizing look.

In truth, they had only walked a few blocks since they had passed the fountain. After a few turns they had ended up it what appeared to be a less glamourous part of the city. The streets had narrowed, though they were still made of the beautiful but faded stone. The buildings were also different. They were taller, some two, three, and a few even four or five stories high and to Kouji they almost looked like apartment complexes.

Noticing Kouji's observations, Beliamon's eyes saddened a bit but she chuckled nonetheless.

"This...is where the students used to live." She responded a bit flatly, and Kouji looked at her strangely once again. "Students and aspiring students."

Kouji continued to look at her strangely, but eventually his attention was pulled away from her to again examine the buildings that could have once been the liveliest place in Ayzahn Ra before it fell.

"Hey Beliamon, look up there. I'd started to think there wasn't any color in this city." Kouji grabbed her attention and she followed his gaze to a certain building.

And her heart stopped.

On the railing of the building, a potwas hanging that was littered with cracks. And in the pot, beautiful blue flowers overflowed, small green vines dancing in the jumble with them. They seemed to look down upon her witha familiar smile.

Beliamon stepped back and gasped, paying no heed to Kouji whatsoever as her sudden action caused him to jump a bit.

"It...it can't be..." She mumbled. "Tara's flowers....how they they still possibly be alive?"

Reluctantly, Beliamon abandoned her fous on the flowers and frantically examined the building. Her eyes widened further as she did so.

The loose handrail near the bottom steps, the faded blue roof, and...and Taramon's flowers blooming right there in front of...their old dorm.

She had Kouji had miraculously stopped right in front of where Beliamon had used to live back when Ayzahn Ra had been flourishing.

"This...this can't be.." Beliamon uttered, clutching her head as a flood of memories she had tried to bury overs the years assaulted her.

"Beliamon!" Kouji exclaimed, at his captor's eyes, and Beliamon was surprised to see, even in her hysteric state, worry in her eyes.

Overwhelmed, Beliamon screamed, unable to take the memories any longer. With one final sigh, she collapsed, and was out cold, a nervous Kouji hovering over her still form.

And then she began to dream.


***

Lei...

A voing rung out in her mind, but she ignored it...snuggling deeper into the warmth.

Leiamon...

The voice sounded more impatient this time, but still she ignored it.

"LEI!!"

With the sudden exclamation, she jolted up and held her head. Across from her, she now heard chuckling.

"Finally. Hurry up, sleepyhead. Do you want to miss chores? You do want to get into a Temple right?"

She looked over and saw her friend, arms akimbo, and giving her a quirky smile. Her silken blue hair drifted down to her shoulders in a cascade, in it a solitary blue flower. She had pale skin, only further accentuated by her sea blue dress, trimmed in white here and there to resemble waves cresting.

She chuckled herself.

"I've never been a light sleeper, Tara, you know that." She, Leiamon, said and ywaned again, finally rising out of bed.

"Yes, I do." Taramon said with another giggle. "What would you do without me?"

"Um...fail?" Leiamon ventured and gave her friend a blank look, who returned it with a balnks look of her own.

A moment of silence.

Then both digimon burst out in laughter, clutching their sides in amusement.

"I'm sure you would get by Lei." Taramon said, recovering herslef and wiping at her eyes. "But seriously, you better hurry up or you're gonna miss HIM."

Leiamon flinched at Taramon's emphasis on the word 'him' and blushed a little. Her roomate cackled as she opened the door, letting sunlight and a fresh morning breeze into their fairly small dorm.

Standing up, Beliamon concentratedand closed her eyes. Lifting a finger and drawing a few runes with it in the air, she was soon dressed. Looking herslef over with a satisfied smile, she joined her friend out on the patio.

Leiamon's style, however, was a bit different from her friend's blue ensamble. She was decked out in black. Instead of a dress, she wore some loose balck jeans and smooth blakc top with the sleeves coming down to her forearms. Her shiny blonde hair was tied up into a ponytail with a black hairband.

"Did I miss him?" Leiamon asked urgently, looking at Taramon for an answer.

"You just made it. He's coming down that way." Taramon said cheerily and pointed with one hand, while with the other she was summoning water to nourish some blue flowers she had hanging in a box on the railing in front of the door of their second story dorm.

Leiamon gasped and leaned over the railing to look past her friend. Surely enough, a figure was swiftly jogginf dwon the street, dodging students as they left their dorms to go to daily chores.

Leiamon began to blush as he got closer and Taramon chuckled next to her as she continued to tend to her flowers.

"Careful there, Lei. Don't fall over the railing." Her friend chastised.

Leiamon only spared her friend a withered look before turning her full attention back to the figure coming down the street.

Slowly, she was able to begin to make make out his features.

He had a lithe frame, only a bit taller than her actually, but one could easily see the muscles on his arms, chest, and legs as he powered his way down the street. Currently, sweat was pouring down his face from his brown shock of hair and he was dressed in just some blue drawstring workout pants and a white workout shirt as he continued his morning run.

It was Yoimon.

She sighed, and then suddenly, it was all over and Yoimon's figure was than of a retresting one as it became further and further away until it was gone alltogether.

Beliamon sighed dreamily again, and let herself drop to the floor to lean against the rail, while images of her and Yoimon danced in her head.

Though something wasn't right. She liked Yoimon well enough, but something struck out in her mind about him. It was like...he wasn't the cutest hge could be.

Oh well, in her book he was cute enough.

Taramon sighed as she pulled her friend to her feet, closed the door, and began to head out to do their own chores.

"You really have it bad for that guy, don't you Lei?" Taramon asked, a hint of amusement in her voice.

Leiamon only continued to stare out into space, a look of bliss on her face.

"I guess I do." She said finally, with a chuckle.

"Then you are gonna talk to him, right?"

"Oh, I can't do that!" Leiamon turned to her head away, embarrassed.

"Then someone else will just snag him!" Tarmon replied esasperatedly, skaing her head as if she and Leimaon had had this conversation before.

"Well...maybe.." Leimon mumbled, unsure.

"There's no maybes about it! If you don't talk to hm soon, someone else will. Mark my words." Taramon warned, giving her friend a serious look. "But right now, we're gonna be late if we don't hurry!"

Beliamon sighed but then smiled.

"You know, a bet Yoimon is a heavy sleeper too. I wish I had chores with him sometime." She said.

"Well, unfortunatley, that I think is impossible. Yoimon is in the Redroof Dorms. We're in the Blueroof Dorms, and they split who you do chores with according to dorms." Tarmon replied as they raced down the street.

"Hmm..." Leiamon mumbled, a devious glint in her eye.

Taramon began to sweat a bit as she caught the familiar look on her friend's face.

"Though I suppose if there was anyone who could find a way around that arrangement, if would be you Lei."

That caused another giggling fit between the girls as they raced to begin another hectic day in Ayzahn Ra.

The two were almost to their assignment station when suddenly...
